courses.Subject: ANIM
courses.Title: Animation II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="212" dept="ANIM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Builds on topics introduced in ANIM 211 Animation I, incorporating advanced animation techniques such as inverse kinematics and dynamics. Requires students to propose, design, and produce a short animation.

courses.Subject: ANIM
courses.Title: Scripting for Animation and Visual Effects
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="231" dept="ANIM" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores modern scripting languages utilized in Animation and Visual Effects operating systems and software tools that are integral to artist productivity and production pipeline scalability.

courses.Subject: ANIM
courses.Title: Professional Practices for Animation & VFX
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="ANIM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a professional orientation to the animation and visual effects industry through an exploration of a variety of projects and studies. In addition to lecture and discussions, students learn to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of animation and visual effects productions from proposals to final delivery, as well as personal development and promotion through personal learning, development of work demonstration materials.

courses.Title: Professional Practices for Animation & VFX

courses.Subject: ARTH
courses.Title: History of Art I: Ancient to Medieval
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="ARTH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Traces the rise of Western civilization from ancient Egypt and Mesopotamia, through Greek and Roman culture to the late Middle Ages, with an emphasis on the evolution of style and symbolism in art.

courses.Subject: ARTH
courses.Title: History of Art III: Modern Art
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ARTH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the history of modern painting and sculpture from 1850 to the present and the phenomenon of Modernism in terms of individual artists, movements, attitudes, and values. Movements to be covered include Impressionism, Symbolism, Expressionism, Cubism, Surrealism, Non-figurative Abstraction, the New York School, and Postmodernism.

courses.Subject: ARTH
courses.Title: History of Modern Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="300" dept="ARTH" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the products of applied design during the past 150 years, including examples of furnishings, industrial design, fashion, and graphic design, in relation to demand, technology and production, standards, fine art, social reform, and the dynamics of consumption. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ARTH
courses.Title: History of Art II: Renaissance to Romanticism
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="102" dept="ARTH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys painting and sculpture created between the 15th century and the mid-19th century, placing artists such as Donatello, Michelangelo, Rubens, and Rembrandt in the context of the evolution of style and symbolism in Western culture.

courses.Subject: ARTH
courses.Title: History of Modern Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="300" dept="ARTH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the products of applied design during the past 150 years, including examples of furnishings, industrial design, fashion, and graphic design, in relation to demand, technology and production, standards, fine art, social reform, and the dynamics of consumption. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: AADM
courses.Title: Creative Placemaking
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="746" dept="AADM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores art practices that bear location and geography in mind, and seek to transform place through the inclusion of creative interventions. It includes examination of the economic and social impacts of arts, arts-led gentrification and neighborhood change, and the contemporary state of placemaking practices in the field. The course offers students the chance to be up to date on one of the driving issues of today's arts funding landscape.

courses.Subject: AADM
courses.Title: Thesis Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="798" dept="AADM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Enables students to begin work on original research related to the thesis, a scholarly work related to the student's individual research interest. In the first term, students conduct primary research, including fieldwork such as interviews, observations, focus groups and surveys. In the second term, students write and revise their written thesis document.

courses.Subject: AADM
courses.Title: Visual Arts Organization Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="753" dept="AADM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Special problems and challenges related to managing visual arts organizations. The course will build on learning from foundation-level courses, discussing issues related to managing art museums, art schools, galleries, public art programs, and more.

courses.Title: Thesis Development

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Computer Design for Design and Merchandising
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="211" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course addresses the use of computer design as a merchandising and design tool for branding and promotion of a business or organization. The student is introduced to the branding process from a visual point of view and will create brand identity materials through the use of computer software programs including Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Color and Trend Forecasting
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="309" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides an overview of the fashion forecasting function in Fashion, Design & Merchandising. Students investigate color and trend forecasting, design research and concepts, and fabric direction. Students apply their knowledge in "hands on" color cards and development of a trend book.

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Visual Merchandising
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="311" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Visual Merchandising combines design skills, consumer psychology and marketing principles to create window displays, floor merchandising and plan-o-grams in a retail environment that entices consumers to buy. Students will investigate related areas of store planning and design, point-of-purchase display, fixture design, and topics on trend in the industry. Students will apply the principles and elements of design in merchandise presentation, analysis and experimentation and field research. Methods of promoting and selling merchandise, analyzing leading retail firms, employing basic methods of displaying merchandise, and developing a basic understanding of the use of special materials and lighting will be integrated into experiential projects outside of the classroom.

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Fashion Photoshop
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T380" dept="DSMR" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course explores the fundamentals of Adobe Photoshop and explores tools such as digital sketches, retouch, colorize, and correct images, geared toward the fashion industry. Discover how quickly an idea is brought to life using Adobe Photoshop

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Retail Image Analysis
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="233" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students will perform an in-depth analysis of theoretical and applied retail product and brand research.  Qualitative, quantitative and triangulation methods of research will be discussed.  The course focuses on researching, writing and presenting various topics in a professional environment.  This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Merchandising Operations & Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on the Apparel Management functions that exist between the merchandising, design, production and promotion elements of the apparel supply chain. The student will be a member of a team that must bring a fully merchandised collection from item selection through production to retail in an ideal Vertical Merchandising System. Forecasting, collection development, production and revisions, allocation of inventory, coordinated visual presentation packaging and problem solving of anomalies in the supply chain are integrated into this course.

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Merc. for Social Ventures
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T380" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course offers students a unique combination of real-world consulting with a mission based company in the Fashion Industry.  Students work in teams to tackle a specific industry challenge across various topic areas and deliver strategies for issues significant to a real client. Students will have the opportunity to submit their final recommendations to a national competition.  Clients and projects vary each term

courses.Subject: DSMR
courses.Title: Design and Merchandising Seminar
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="477" dept="DSMR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides reading and discussion of pertinent topics of current concern in the professional area of design and merchandising. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Title: Professional Practices
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="DIGM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

In addition to lecture and discussions, allows students to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of digital media production from proposals to product delivery.

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Digital Storytelling
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="DIGM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: By surfing the internet and playing computer games, by lectures, assigned readings, class screening, and research projects, this class explores the impact of digital media on art, design and daily living. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Digital Storytelling
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="DIGM" sect="003" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Professional Practices
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="DIGM" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a professional orientation to the field through an exploration of a variety of digital media projects. In addition to lecture and discussions, allows students to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of digital media production from proposals to product delivery.

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Professional Practices
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="DIGM" sect="004" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a professional orientation to the field through an exploration of a variety of digital media projects. In addition to lecture and discussions, allows students to take active part in role plays and presentations to achieve an understanding of the importance of team building, team work, and team management in all phases of digital media production from proposals to product delivery.

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Digital Storytelling
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="DIGM" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: By surfing the internet and playing computer games, by lectures, assigned readings, class screening, and research projects, this class explores the impact of digital media on art, design and daily living. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: DIGM
courses.Title: Explorations in New Media
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="451" dept="DIGM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Through class presentations, field trips, discussions, readings, screenings and guest speakers; this class bridges artistic and technical aspects of new media in theory and practice. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: FMTV
courses.Title: Show Business
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="T280" dept="FMTV" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An in-depth exploration of subjects not currently covered in the required curriculum.

courses.Subject: FMST
courses.Title: The Films of Gus Van Sant
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T280" dept="FMST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: FMST
courses.Title: Japanese Cinema: Kurosawa
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="293" dept="FMST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will be a survey of some of the major films of Akira Kurosawa, who is widely heralded as one of the greatest filmmakers of the 20th century. His films will be looked at in the context of both Japanese cinema, especially the cinema that preceded him, and world cinema in general.

courses.Subject: FMST
courses.Title: Hollywoodland II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="291" dept="FMST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course continues to examine the history, culture and mythology of Hollywood through films the entertainment industry has made about itself. In this course, the films looked at are primarily from the 1980s on, including "The Stunt Man," "My Favorite Year," "The Comedian" and "The Artist." Also discussed: the effect of television on the film industry, the breakup of the studio system in the late 40¿s-early 50¿s, the rise of programming created for HBO and other pay cable outlets, and changing perceptions of the business itself.

courses.Subject: FMST
courses.Title: The Horror Film
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="352" dept="FMST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course reviews the history of the horror film and its various sub-genres and analyzes the methods employed in the most successful films.  Students dissect the representation of evil and the impact these films have on culture.

courses.Subject: VSCM
courses.Title: Visual Communication V
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="333" dept="VSCM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on information graphics, including signage, environmental graphic design, and exhibit design. Information graphics are graphic visual representations of information, data or knowledge. These graphics present complex information quickly and clearly. Studio.

courses.Subject: VSCM
courses.Title: Graphic Design: 20th Century and Beyond
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="VSCM" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Concentrates on impact and significance of the graphic design profession in society through the history and movements of the profession and the work of 20th-century masters of visual communication.  Students will analyze conceptual and contextual relationships and develop greater awareness of stylistic content and its relevance to the culture. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: VSCM
courses.Title: Experimental Publication Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="370" dept="VSCM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course concentrates on exploring alternative formats and unique delivery systems for the transfer of information. Special emphasis is placed on developing appropriate imagery for the defined readership, formatting, the use of a comprehensive grid system and the development of a wayfinding system for the publication. The course will build a greater awareness of proportion, readability and information transfer, and will reinforce the use of color as a visual communication tool.

courses.Subject: VSCM
courses.Title: Graphic Design: 20th Century and Beyond
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="VSCM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Students will analyze conceptual and contextual relationships and develop greater awareness of stylistic content and its relevance to the culture. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: VSCM
courses.Title: Design on Site
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="360" dept="VSCM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Weekly visits to studios of various design disciplines such as small graphic design offices, environmental graphic design firms, advertising agencies, book and magazine publishers, and website developers.  A written report is due at the end of the term.

courses.Subject: INTR
courses.Title: Visualization I: Computer Imaging
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="160" dept="INTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An introductory course that explores the use of proprietary computer applications for communications and the preparation of visual materials in Interior Design.  The course introduces and reinforces classic design principles for expert visual communication of ideas through digital techniques from an Interior Design perspective.

courses.Subject: INTR
courses.Title: Interior Studio II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="233" dept="INTR" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers diagramming program requirements, designing for complex spatial requirements with an awareness of building systems (e.g., partitions, heating/ventilating/cooling, lighting), and furniture. Includes professionally juried presentations.

courses.Subject: INTR
courses.Title: Visualization IV: 3D Modeling
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="245" dept="INTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An intensive introduction to advanced modeling and rendering software.  Students will explore lighting, materiality, advanced form and spatial experience through realistic three-dimensional digital models.

courses.Title: Visualization IV: 3D Modeling

courses.Subject: INTR
courses.Title: Visual Culture: Furniture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="305" dept="INTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An overview of furniture in relationship to interiors, and its influences reaching from the roots of antiquity to the impact of technology in today's products. It is the study of artifacts from various time periods and cultures in relation to social and political developments, life and work styles, visual arts, and economic influences.

courses.Subject: INTR
courses.Title: Interior Detailing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="350" dept="INTR" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: University Chorus
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A large chorus that studies and performs music of many styles; performs each term. May be repeated for credit.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: University Orchestra
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="109" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is a full orchestra that performs concert repertoire of various periods from the 18th century to the present day.  Wind, brass, and percussionists must be in the concert band in order to participate.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Chamber Music: Strings
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="118" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: MUSC 118 forms its participants into various sized string groups from trios and quartets to octets. The repertoire spans music of the classical tradition and beyond, from the modern day back to the 17th century. These small groups will perform as part of a larger chamber recital at the end of each term.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Music Theory I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="121" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: MUSC 121 covers the foundations of: notation, major/minor scales and keys, intervals, chord construction, phrase construction, small forms, and basic techniques of harmonizing a melody. The methodology centers on analysis combined with application.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Introduction to Music
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="130" dept="MUSC" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an introduction to music in the European classical tradition, including elements of melody, harmony, rhythm, texture, structure, history, and principal composers. Emphasizes listening with understanding.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Class Piano I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="190" dept="MUSC" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Uses a group situation to teach basic performance skills and beginning instruction on piano.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Rock Music Since the Mid-60s
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="238" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys rock music from the mid-60s through the mid-90s.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Private Lesson: Composition
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="241" dept="MUSC" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Weekly private music lessons on an instrument or voice as indicated by the section number. Lessons are fifty minutes per week. The specific day and time is mutually agreed upon by the instructor and the student. Musical style, level of ability, and learning objectives are individually based. Students are encouraged to contact the instructor if they have questions. Students are charged a lab fee every term they register.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: World Musics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="331" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys various musical traditions from around the world in their cultural contexts. Includes selected music from Africa, the Americas, Europe, South Asia, Southeast Asia, Northeast Asia, West Asia, and Oceania.

courses.Title: Jazz Orchestra
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="107" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Offers rehearsal, study, and performance of jazz compositions for both large and small ensembles; concerts given on and off campus, sometimes with guest soloists. May be repeated for credit.

courses.Description: Performs gospel music drawn from both traditional and contemporary sources. Performance opportunities for both singers and instrumentalists. Concerts given on and off campus each term. May be repeated for credit.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Music Fundamentals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="120" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Music Fundamentals teaches students essential skills and knowledge relating to Western music.  Focus is placed on ear training and core music theory concepts.  This course perfectly compliments any student¿s musical playing ability, beginning to advanced, and is essential to further musical development.

courses.Subject: MUSC
courses.Title: Introduction to Music
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="130" dept="MUSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an introduction to music in the European classical tradition, including elements of melody, harmony, rhythm, texture, structure, history, and principal composers. Emphasizes listening with understanding.

courses.Description: This course surveys film music from the silent film era to the present. Topics will include the composers of the genre, the changing musical styles through the decades, and the techniques used by film composers.

courses.Subject: PROD
courses.Title: Computer Aided Imagining in Product Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="225" dept="PROD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is an applied computer class in which students pursue the development of design projects using current product design photo-realistic rendering softward for object design and three-dimensional modeling of products applicable to rapid prototyping.

courses.Subject: PROD
courses.Title: Seminar Professional Landscape
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="245" dept="PROD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: In this course students explore current trends in the product design profession today. Students will research and present insights into important design issues, trends, and criticism in contemporary product design. Through extensive readings and discussions, students develop an understanding of the relationship of product design to society and culture.

courses.Subject: PROD
courses.Title: Applied Materials in Product Design
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="255" dept="PROD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course emphasizes the practical relationship between product design and the manufacturing industry and the technical considerations that influence the choice of material and process for small batch and mass production.

courses.Description: Workshop course that covers the fundamentals of writing scripts for film and television. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: SCRP
courses.Title: Writing the Short Film
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="280" dept="SCRP" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on creating scripts for films under thirty minutes in length. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Title: Screenplay Story Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="370" dept="SCRP" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides a thorough understanding of methods used to develop story ideas from initial concept to complete screen story, including pitching, structuring, and creating treatments. Students pitch and develop several stories which can then be used to create full-length scripts in advanced workshops.

courses.Title: Playwriting Workshop II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="383" dept="SCRP" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The second of a two-course sequence in which students write a 90-minute, two-act play.

courses.Subject: TVST
courses.Title: Art of TV Comedy
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="361" dept="TVST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores the history of television comedy and examines its role as both programming staple and artistic form.  By examining how sitcoms reflect our society and its most important social issues, the course seeks to enable students to gauge where both culture and the sitcom are headed.

courses.Subject: TVST
courses.Title: Teen Drama
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="364" dept="TVST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course looks at acclaimed television programs from the fifties to the present, which present the experience of teenagers as central to the overall show. Students will discuss the content and form of each show, in terms of the directing, the cinematography, the editing, the production design, the sound track, as well as the acting.

courses.Subject: TVST
courses.Title: Science Fiction Television
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="363" dept="TVST" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students will view a progression of science fiction television shows from the fifties to the present time.  Students will examine how each show uses an imagined world as a vehicle for exploring facets of our own world. The concepts and the production values will be discussed for each show.

courses.Subject: THTR
courses.Title: Theatre Perf. Prac: Adv Improv
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="131" dept="THTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides practical experience in acting for the stage. Requires student to play a role in a Department of Performing Arts theatre production. May be repeated for credit.

courses.Subject: THTR
courses.Title: Contemporary Musical Theatre
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="232" dept="THTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The Musical is one of America¿s greatest contributions to the world of theatre. Through class discussions, viewing live performance, audio/video examples, and readings students will analyze the changes in the American Musical form beginning in the 1960s to the present and predict its future direction.

courses.Subject: THTR
courses.Title: Acting: Fundamentals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="THTR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introductory acting course. Covers basic exercises, improvisations, fundamentals of voice production, and stage movement.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Accelerated Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="104" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is an accelerated course offered as a substitute for VSST 101. The work concentrates on two-dimensional space with a primary focus in black and white. The course is 8 hours per week delivered in three weeks.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Accelerated Design II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="105" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is an accelerated course offered as a substitute for VSST 102.  The work concentrates on color, expanding the two-dimensional vocabulary.  The course is 8 hours per week delivered in three weeks.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Accelerated Design III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="106" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is an accelerated course offered as a substitute for VSST 103. The work concentrates on three-dimensional space with a primary focus on materials and craftsmanship. The course meets 8 hours per week delivered in four weeks.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Introductory Drawing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="110" dept="VSST" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides basic understanding of the perceptual problems in drawing, including how three-dimensional objects can be represented on a two-dimensional surface.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Figure Drawing I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="111" dept="VSST" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces drawing of the human figure, with emphasis on composition and shape-area relationships.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Figure Drawing I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="111" dept="VSST" sect="063" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces drawing of the human figure, with emphasis on composition and shape-area relationships.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Multimedia: Performance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Investigates 4D design (the organization of space over time) using objects, light, sound, movement, gesture, and language in solo and group presentations. Incorporates conceptualization, experimentation, perception and analysis.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Multimedia: Space
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="202" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Concentrates on environment and spatial concepts. Expands previous concern with the object and personal space to envision space and the action within. Requires students to work individually or in groups to create works at this new scale.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Multimedia: Materials
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="203" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course augments the design studio experiences by introducing the influence of material characteristics and fabrication techniques.  Students learn how to design projects, reduce them to the specific parts, make the parts and assemble the work in a coordinated sequence.  Work is done in the Visual Studies Arts Annex woodshop.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Painting I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="301" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: New techniques, materials, and terminology, are introduced through a series of assignments based on observations of still life¿s and life models. Emphasis is placed on the application of color to articulate space and the development of individual expression.

courses.Subject: VSST
courses.Title: Screenprint I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="321" dept="VSST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Water based and photographic techniques are combined to create painterly and precise imagery in the building of a body of work.  Techniques may include stencil-making, digitizing, mono-printing and color exploration.  This course introduces the foundations of technical skills, language and theories used by the artist as printmaker.

courses.Title: Screenprint I

courses.Subject: WMGD
courses.Title: Web Graphics II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="WMGD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Continues WMGD 220.  Increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics.  Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.

courses.Subject: WMGD
courses.Title: Web Graphics II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="WMGD" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Continues WMGD 220.  Increases the complexity and scope of the art direction and design for web graphics.  Students will focus on professional quality web pages using dedicated software that adheres to current industry standards.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Architecture and Society II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="142" dept="ARCH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the evolution of Western architectural thought, form, space and structures in light of changing human values and institutions. Course covers early monumental architecture of the Western Hemisphere and then considers the evolution of Western architecture from the "Dark Ages" through the development and spread of Renaissance architecture across Europe and Latin America.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Structures - Part B
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T180" dept="ARCH" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Studio 1-AE
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="191" dept="ARCH" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Architectural engineering majors only. Covers basic design principles using three-dimensional abstract and applied projects. Exercises heighten observation skills.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Sustainable Built Environment II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="ARCH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students will examine the work of scientists, designers, authors, artists, architects, engineers, planners, etc to gain a deeper conceptual understanding of current and emerging strategies in sustainability and the complex and integrated systems approach to the built environment in the present and near future.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Studies in Vernacular Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="348" dept="ARCH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A topical survey of world traditions of vernacular architecture, with emphasis on houses and dwelling environments. The survey topics include basics of shelter, construction methods, response to climate, patterns of settlement, social and economic organization, cultural expression, and methods of research and analysis.

courses.Subject: ARCH
courses.Title: Public Space and Placemaking
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T380" dept="ARCH" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is an introduction to the spaces between buildings in an urban environment, their ¿publicness¿, and the programming that takes place within them. These are the places of play and protest, but also streets and sidewalks, as well as ¿semi-public¿ spaces like libraries or airports. The focus of this class will be on the history of these spaces and how they came to be ¿public¿, a greater understanding of the typology of public and private places that we interact with in our public lives, and methodologies with which to assess them. Critical assessment of public space will be key to the class, including how they are used, who is and is not included in the everyday use and creation of these spaces, and how best to design and maintain public space through placemaking principles. Students will come away from this class with a toolkit of methods to use in studying public space through a direct observation ¿spatial ethnography¿ assignment to analyze a public space of their choice in Philadelphia.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="610" dept="AAML" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: AAML
courses.Title: Technology Tools for Arts and Cultural Managers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="660" dept="AAML" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course enables students to understand, use, and deploy technology systems and tools to advance an arts and cultural organization¿s mission and vision. Students will research and explore trends and developments in electronic marketing, social media, website design, audience engagement strategies, and customer relationship management. This course will have a particular focus on analytics and data-driven decision-making as well as cultivating an understanding of the participatory nature of contemporary arts experiences.

courses.Subject: AAML
courses.Title: Revenue Development in Arts and Cultural Orgs.
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="575" dept="AAML" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores how arts and cultural entities attract financial resources, and the kinds of money needed for different purposes and types of cultural organizations, including museums. Topics covered include donor cultivation and stewardship, capitalization, grantwriting and the grants process, earned income, contributed income, public funding, and recent trends in fund development.

courses.Subject: FASH
courses.Title: Fashion Design I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="529" dept="FASH" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Inspiration and research is essential to the creation of new ideas and the fulfillment of design problems. Fashion Design I examines the use of both unusual and familiar sources of inspiration to develop uniquely creative garments. Resources may include: architecture, film, furniture, historic costume (DHCC), industrial design, interior design, nature, painting, sculpture, transportation, etc. The ability to think on paper is stressed as well as the manipulation of a variety of materials and media through the conceptualization and development of both singular realizations and coordinated groups.

Topics will include recording dialog, location sound recording, sound effects design, music editing, and multi-track mixing.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="306" dept="FMVD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will prepare students to make quality films on very small budgets.  We will look at how aspiring filmmakers can survive in the world after college without access to an equipment office and readily available crews.  Students will examine the early work of contemporary filmmakers and apply these lessons to a 5 - 8 minute short film.

courses.Description: The second of a two-course sequence in which students produce a film or video project.

courses.Subject: FMVD
courses.Title: Audio Production and Post
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="206" dept="FMVD" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is an introduction to the creation and manipulation, of digital audio files.  It is geared towards the Digital Media student, with respect to applying soundtrack elements to their images.  Topics will include recording dialog, location sound recording, sound effects design, music editing, and multi-track mixing.

courses.Title: Audio Production and Post

courses.Subject: FMVD
courses.Title: Film Action Choreography
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="232" dept="FMVD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: In this course, a variety of different types of action scenes ranging from fistfights to car chases will be studied. Through screenings of successful action scenes and shot by shot analysis the student will learn the importance of camera placement and ample coverage. Through the combination of screenings and hands on action arrangement the student will gain an understanding of what is involved in a successful action sequence and have to skills to execute them.

courses.Subject: FMVD
courses.Title: Cutting Trailers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="307" dept="FMVD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: View, analyze and produce theotrical trailers and promos, as well as study the marketing methods that drive these productions. The history of trailers will also be studied.

courses.Subject: FMVD
courses.Title: Steadicam Workshop
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="FMVD" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A hands-on introduction to the use of the Steadicam as a creative production tool. The course will cover basic theory, set-up, and operation of the Steadicam with various cameras.

courses.Description: This is an entry level course for non-interactive digital media majors that introduces students to the process of managing online content as well as how to define the presentation styles and interaction modes for the user through the use of a content management system.

courses.Subject: MUSL

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="750" dept="MUSL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is the first term course of a two term required practicum for all museum leadership students. Students will work in teams at a local museum to complete a practical project that will expose them to contemporary museum practices.

courses.Subject: PHTO
courses.Title: Photography
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="110" dept="PHTO" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Lecture-laboratory course in black and white photography. With a combination of lectures, assignments and group critiques, students learn to see photographically through an exploration of the basic tools, techniques and aesthetics of photography. For PHTO Majors, a manual 35mm film camera is required. For PHTO Minors & non-majors a digital point and shoot camera or DSLR, 16 megapixels or greater is required. Cameras that are capable of shooting in RAW format are strongly recommended.
