courses.Title: Cell, Molecular & Developmental Biology II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="211" dept="BIO" sect="A" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

An introduction to the principles of disease and pathogenicity, host interaction and immunological response.  Laboratories focus on the basic techniques to culture and student microorganisms.

courses.Subject: BIO
courses.Title: Genetics I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="244" dept="BIO" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys Mendelian, microbial, molecular, and population genetics. Discusses model systems and analytical methods used by geneticists to understand gene functions at cellular, organismal, and population levels.

courses.Subject: BIO
courses.Title: Biochemistry Laboratory
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="306" dept="BIO" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers biochemical techniques ranging from basic laboratory preparatory work such as making solutions to the measurement of enzyme kinetics and substrate specificity.

courses.Subject: BIO
courses.Title: Biology of Aging
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="412" dept="BIO" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Discusses ageing at the organismal, organ, cellular, and molecular levels. Discussions include chronological verses biological aging, normal and abnormal human physiology of aging, current theories of aging, the effect of caloric restriction on aging, and the molecular mechanisms that underlie normal and abnormal aging.

courses.Subject: BIO
courses.Title: Research

courses.Description: Provides guided research in biology, molecular biology, microbiology, cell or human physiology, genetics, biochemistry, or biotechnology.

courses.Title: Applied Chemistry
courses.Description: For business majors. Covers physical and chemical properties of substances used in consumer products. Uses examples from the areas of food and nutrition, pharmacology, and the petrochemical industry.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="220" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A workshop course in the theory and practice of making effective professional presentations for the technical and business professional. Provides a systems approach to the planning, production, and presentation of visual/aural programs.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Electronic Publishing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="335" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Electronic Publishing gives students applied and theoretical knowledge of professional electronic publishing.  Students will focus on issues relating to writing and integrating text and graphics to create websites and on-line publications.  Students will also consider how issues in document design and usability can be used to evaluate websites.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Event Planning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="363" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will provide the student with the theoretical and practical fundamentals in understanding the complexities of producing Special Events across all major industries.  Special Events addresses all elements of the communication process.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Ethnography for Street Photogr
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T380" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Photographically documenting life on the streets has been going on for over 100 years, and is being done today by thousands of people worldwide. COM 380-001 Street Photos as Ethnography examines what others have done in this area, and provides you with an opportunity to craft your own observations about our "socialscape" through photography. So while you will be learning about creating visual ethnographies, you'll be having some creative fun in this course as well. If you are a "people watcher" this is the course for you. All you will need is some sort of photographic tool: anything from the camera on your Smartphone to a professional DSLR will suffice for the class - that and a willingness to explore life on the streets of Philadelphia.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Public Relations Campaign Planning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="386" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This capstone course will focus on the advanced aspects of public relations: how to analyze, plan, conduct, and implement successful public relations campaigns systematically and scientifically.  Students will create full-scale PR campaigns, including budget, media materials, and social media tools, for their real-world "clients," and implement key activities.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Senior Project in Communication I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="491" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers planning and execution of a professional project that integrates the academic and practical knowledge the student has acquired in his or her major.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Strategic Social Media Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="536" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students explore the evolution of social media and the impact that ¿media convergence¿ culture has on brands and organizations. Social media platforms facilitated by Web-based and mobile technologies are explored and evaluated. Theoretical approaches and research-based best practices for strategic social media marketing plans and integrating social platforms/tools and technologies into existing marketing plans and legacy media are explored. Students will analyze how real brands are using social media, engage in social media activities and develop and implement elements of a strategic social media plan for an organization or business including: creation of a social media space, evaluation plan that will utilize native or third-party analytic tools and a plan for best practices for social media use in a crisis.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Theories of Communication and Persuasion
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="610" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the application of theories and models of communication and persuasion. Introduces theories underlying technical communication and issues informing the discipline. Draws readings from a number of disciplines, such as rhetoric, cognitive psychology, discourse analysis, linguistics, and communication.

courses.Title: Mass Media and Society

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Introduction to Journalism
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="160" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed to acquaint students with various forms of basic newswriting and interview techniques. Students will learn how to write leads and short articles under deadline pressure. This is a writing-intensive course.  Although writing is the main emphasis of this class, students also will learn newsroom organization, ethics and press law.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Theory and Models of Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Surveys historical and contemporary attempts to understand the process of human communication, using examples from the literature of interpersonal, group, organizational, and mass communication.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Quantitative Research Methods in Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="221" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course introduces students to quantitative methods used in the study of communication. The course will help student develop techniques to understand research problems in communication settings. Students will consider applications, including survey research, content analysis, usability testing, and experimental design, and will discuss procedures for developing, operationalizing, and testing questions within communication environments.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Audio Journalism
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will familiarize students with the creation of audio news and editorial content that is used not only in traditional radio broadcasting, but also in web-delivered programming such as podcasts and streamed audio. Students will learn the unique characteristics of audio journalism, practice ¿writing for the ear¿ and will record and edit digital audio.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Business Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="COM" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Public Relations Research, Measurement and Evaluation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="284" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Public Relations research is the first essential element in the process of Public Relations.  The purpose of this course is to introduce students to the methods of quantitative and qualitative research most widely used to assess an organization's public relations efforts.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Technical Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Develops skills in communicating technical information. Focuses on writing letters, resumes, proposals, reports, and instructions. Offers extensive writing practice along with exercises and presentations. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Description: Develops skills in communicating technical information. Focuses on writing letters, resumes, proposals, reports, and instructions. Offers extensive writing practice along with exercises and presentations. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Science Writing
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="COM" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A workshop course in writing on scientific subjects. Includes analysis of the current market for science writing; examination of exemplary pieces of science writing; instruction in finding article ideas, interviewing, and working with editors; and production of feature-length articles. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Electronic Publishing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="335" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Electronic Publishing gives students applied and theoretical knowledge of professional electronic publishing.  Students will focus on issues relating to writing and integrating text and graphics to create websites and on-line publications.  Students will also consider how issues in document design and usability can be used to evaluate websites.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Social Media and Communication
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="352" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Social Media provide a communication system for connecting, collaborating and building community. We will examine how these functions may be applied in personal, professional and political contexts. Activities will include readings, case studies and discussions. Students will create a strategic plan for using social media for personal, organizational or political purposes.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Grant Writing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="375" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students explore the grant writing process, from the development of an idea and researching appropriate contributors, to writing a fully realized grant proposal, complete with budget. Course topics also include surveying the political and social climate before developing an idea, assessing an organization's capabilities to handle a project, and performing through literature reviews. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Media Effects
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="385" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Some people believe that the mass media rule our lives, making us fat, violent, sexist, etc.   Some think that media are irrelevant.  Of course these arguments are extreme and simplifications.    In this course, we ask:  What are the facts regarding media effects research?

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Public Relations Campaign Planning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="386" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This capstone course will focus on the advanced aspects of public relations: how to analyze, plan, conduct, and implement successful public relations campaigns systematically and scientifically.  Students will create full-scale PR campaigns, including budget, media materials, and social media tools, for their real-world "clients," and implement key activities.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Senior Project in Communication II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="492" dept="COM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Requires completion and evaluation of the project begun in COM 491.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Grant Writing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="575" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students develop the skills needed to write an effective grant proposal. Topics include idea development, analyzing a team's capabilities to complete a project, developing a clear plan of attack, locating funding sources, honing research skills, and effectively using graphic elements in proposal design.

courses.Subject: COM
courses.Title: Investigative Journalism
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="660" dept="COM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An intensive hands-on course in researching and writing investigative news stories.  Students will select and cover beats and submit a series of in-depth articles on deadline.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric II: Advanced Research and Evidence-Based Writing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="102" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Advances students¿ development in the writing processes. Promotes a critical evaluation and integration of information into their own writing as they research complex and open-ended issues. Identifies the relationships between rhetorical situations, the status of claims, and the need for evidence and warrants. Continues review of grammar, style, and documentation conventions. Encourages collaboration and effective search strategies of the Internet and library resources. Promotes students¿ reflective analysis and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric II: Advanced Research and Evidence-Based Writing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="102" dept="ENGL" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Promotes a critical evaluation and integration of information into their own writing as they research complex and open-ended issues. Identifies the relationships between rhetorical situations, the status of claims, and the need for evidence and warrants. Continues review of grammar, style, and documentation conventions. Encourages collaboration and effective search strategies of the Internet and library resources. Promotes students¿ reflective analysis and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric III: Themes and Genres
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ENGL" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Advances students' development in the writing and research processes and their understanding of how genres of writing shape meaning. Some courses may focus on the student's academic and discipline-specific experiences; Others may be based on literary or social themes. Promotes a critical reading of texts, reflective analysis, and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric III: Themes and Genres
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ENGL" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Advances students' development in the writing and research processes and their understanding of how genres of writing shape meaning. Some courses may focus on the student's academic and discipline-specific experiences; Others may be based on literary or social themes. Promotes a critical reading of texts, reflective analysis, and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Romanticism to Modernism
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="202" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A survey of Western literature of the 19th and 20th centuries focusing on the major periods of Romanticism (Blake, Coleridge and Keats), Realism (Balzac and Ibsen), and Modernism (Kafka, Borges and Woolf). This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: British Literature II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="212" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A historical survey of British literature from the turn of the nineteenth century to the present; students will read texts selected to represent major authors, forms and thematic material of the Romantic, Victorian and modern periods.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Readings in Poetry
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="215" dept="ENGL" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A basic course which focuses on poetry as a genre through the study of a variety of poems organized by theme, period or form. One of three genre courses. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Science Fiction
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="303" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides reading and discussion of works illustrating the development of modern science fiction.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Shakespeare
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="315" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on Shakespeare's major plays and sonnets, providing the historical and cultural contexts that gave rise to his work. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: The Hispanic Caribbean
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="325" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A variable topics course which focuses on a particular national or regional literature within its cultural, historical and political contexts (i.e., African Literature; French Literature; Latin American Literature). May be repeated for credit.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Law and Literature
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="360" dept="ENGL" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course examines the relationship between literature and the society it reflects and helps shape.  May be repeated for credit. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric II: Advanced Research and Evidence-Based Writing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="102" dept="ENGL" sect="300" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Advances students¿ development in the writing processes. Promotes a critical evaluation and integration of information into their own writing as they research complex and open-ended issues. Identifies the relationships between rhetorical situations, the status of claims, and the need for evidence and warrants. Continues review of grammar, style, and documentation conventions. Encourages collaboration and effective search strategies of the Internet and library resources. Promotes students¿ reflective analysis and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric III: Themes and Genres
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Advances students' development in the writing and research processes and their understanding of how genres of writing shape meaning. Some courses may focus on the student's academic and discipline-specific experiences; Others may be based on literary or social themes. Promotes a critical reading of texts, reflective analysis, and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Composition and Rhetoric III: Themes and Genres
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ENGL" sect="350" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Some courses may focus on the student's academic and discipline-specific experiences; Others may be based on literary or social themes. Promotes a critical reading of texts, reflective analysis, and a positive attitude toward writing.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Renaissance to the Enlightenment
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A survey of Western literature from the Renaissance to the Enlightenment, focusing on works by Cervantes, Erasmus, Rabelais, Petrarch, Voltaire, Rousseau, Swift and Pope.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: American Literature II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="206" dept="ENGL" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A survey of American literature from the Civil War through the 21st century, including works by such writers as Kate Chopin, W.E.B. Du Bois, T.S. Eliot, William Faulkner, F. Scott Fitzgerald, Henry James, Philip Roth, Mark Twain and John Updike. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Readings in Fiction
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="214" dept="ENGL" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A basic course, which focuses on fiction as a genre through the study of a variety of short stories and fiction, organized by theme, period or form.  One of three genre courses.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Literature & Science
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="300" dept="ENGL" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course studies the impact of scientific and technological change on works of literature and art produced in various historical periods. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Arthurian Legend
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="ENGL" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This is a variable topics course, focusing on the literature of a particular period (i.e., Classical Literature; Victorian Literature; the Harlem Renaissance). May be repeated for credit. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Franz Kafka
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="ENGL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A course focused on intensive study of one or more authors, for example: Jane Austen; Joseph Conrad; Hemingway, Faulkner and Fitzgerald; Writers of the Harlem Renaissance; Carlos Fuentes and Gabriel Garcia Marquez.  May be repeated for credit. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ENGL
courses.Title: Mythology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="335" dept="ENGL" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course investigates the specific forms mythological stories have taken in the literature, art and ritual of some or all of the following:  Greece, Rome, Iceland, Mesopotamia and Native American and European cultures in the United States.

courses.Subject: FREN
courses.Title: French I
courses.Section_Comments: Placement test required with prior experience
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="FREN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Title: French IV

courses.Description: Intermediate French. Includes grammar review, listening, speaking, and reading, with individual audiolingual practice. Offered all terms.

courses.Subject: FREN
courses.Title: French Media: infos ou infaux
courses.Section_Comments: Placement test required with prior experience
courses.Description: This course provides an introduction to the role of language and media in society, including sociolinguistics, gender, media studies, and communication. The content of this course may change every term it is offered and is repeatable for credit. Taught in French.

courses.Subject: GST
courses.Title: Crossing the Bridge
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T280" dept="GST" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed for students who are experiencing the "otherness" of culturally diverse groups through living, studying or working abroad. Students will integrate and build on their intercultural experiences through a self-reflective process, and will become aware of the impact the students' own culture has on these experiences.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: The History of Drexel University
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="125" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides an overview and analysis of the history of Drexel University, founded in 1891 as the Drexel Institute of Art, Science, and Industry by banker and philanthropist Anthony J. Drexel. By the 1920s Drexel had evolved into a professional engineering school with a co-operative education program. By the 1950s, Drexel was a powerhouse as a local provider of technical talent¿and it became Drexel University in 1970. As the local economy went through a brutal deindustrial transformation Drexel had to change or face bankruptcy. The 1990s saw Drexel recovering and by the beginning of the new century Drexel evolved again in a period of change marked by the acquisition and founding of medical, nursing, public health schools, and law schools.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Intro to Africana Studies
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T180" dept="HIST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: United States History since 1900
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="203" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines America as economic giant, world political power, and scene of social change.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Introduction to Latin American History
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="270" dept="HIST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Takes a thematic approach to Latin American history, examining modernization and tradition, sex roles and family honor, love and lust, dictatorship and human rights abuses, poverty and crime, terrorism and revolutionary violence. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: The History of Philadelphia
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="276" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course surveys the history of Philadelphia through pre-colonial, colonial, and industrial eras to the present day. Philadelphia is investigated as an economic, social, cultural, and political center. Students read primary and secondary sources and conduct original research into Philadelphia's history. Lectures and discussions are complemented by on-site historical investigations.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: History of Science: Ancient to Medieval
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="287" dept="HIST" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the history of Western science from the Ancient to Medieval period. Surveys the intellectual content of natural philosophy (science) especially Babylonian, Greek, Roman sciences and medicine, in broader political, economic, social, and cultural context.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Themes in World Civilization II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="162" dept="HIST" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an analysis of civilizations from the 12th century to 1815 viewed through key themes and interpretive debates, including the development of the nation-state, interaction between civilizations, the concept of cultural unity, religious upheaval, disease and science, the relationship between culture and politics, and the nature of revolutions.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: United States History, 1815-1900
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="202" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the emergence of modern America to the close of the Spanish-American War.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Twentieth Century Russia & the USSR
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="255" dept="HIST" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the last years of imperial Russia, showing the background to the revolutions of 1917, followed by a study of the institutions and personalities of the USSR.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: History of Pennsylvania
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="275" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course introduces students to the history and culture of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania. Major topics include: the geography of Pennsylvania, Native-American culture before the Colonial Era, the Colonial Era and the governance of the Penn family, the development of the state¿s economy throughout the 18th, 19th, and 20th centuries, the role of urban centers such as Philadelphia and Pittsburgh, and the role of immigration and diversity in the history of the state.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Technology in Historical Perspective
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="285" dept="HIST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the causal interrelations between technological developments and economic, social, intellectual, and political aspects of Western civilization from the 18th century to the present.

courses.Subject: HIST
courses.Title: Transnational History of Science, Technology and Environment
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="385" dept="HIST" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Drawing on methods from environmental history, history of science, and history of technology, this course explores historical connections around the globe. Focusing on concrete things that form part of the material culture of modernity, such as plants, commodities, infrastructure, diseases, energy resources, or climate, we examine climate, imperialism, and global governance structures, among other things.

courses.Subject: MATH

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="411" dept="MATH" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Topics include multiple regression and model selection, nonlinear and logistic regression, analysis of covariance, multi-factor analysis of variance, nested, factorial and repeated measures experimental designs, random effects, and introduction to bootstrap methods and randomization tests.   Programming statistical applications in R will be included.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="411" dept="MATH" sect="062" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Scientific data analysis and experimental design.  Topics include multiple regression and model selection, nonlinear and logistic regression, analysis of covariance, multi-factor analysis of variance, nested, factorial and repeated measures experimental designs, random effects, and introduction to bootstrap methods and randomization tests.   Programming statistical applications in R will be included.

courses.Subject: PHYS
courses.Title: Fundamentals of Physics I
courses.Section_Comments: Also register for a lecture & a lab
courses.Description: First of a four course sequence teaching fundamental physics to engineering and science majors. Topics include: description of motion, inertial and non-inertial frames, special relativity, Newton's Laws, translational and rotational equilibrium, one- and two-dimensional motion, fundamental forces, inverse square laws, Gauss' Law, Bohr's quantization, rotational dynamics, potential energy, black holes, determinism and chaos.

courses.Subject: PHYS
courses.Title: Survey of the Universe
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="131" dept="PHYS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an overview of modern astronomy, including the scientific method; telescopes; stars and star clusters; stellar evolution; galaxies and the large-scale structure of the universe; and the Big Bang. May also include periodic visits to the university observatory.

courses.Title: Introductory Physics II
courses.Section_Comments: Also register for a lecture & a lab
courses.Description: Second part of a three-course algebra-based sequence providing a comprehensive introduction to Physics. Covers fluids, vibrations, waves, sound, heat and thermodynamics, geometrical optics and optical instrumentation. Includes labs to enrich class material.

courses.Subject: PHYS
courses.Title: Light and Sound
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="175" dept="PHYS" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: With an interactive lecture format and an inquiry-based student-centered recitation, this course will give a conceptual introduction to topics in physics such as waves, sound, light, and color. Students will complete an interdisciplinary, real-world project that will relate their specific major to an area of physics. Students will also be able to solve one-step algebra problems and conceptually describe topics in physics.

courses.Subject: PHYS
courses.Title: Computational Lab for Light and Sound
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="176" dept="PHYS" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students will experiment with computational methods as they relate to physics topics such as waves, sound, light, and color using tools such as Excel, Python, code.org, and Blockscad.

courses.Title: Fundamentals of Physics III
courses.Section_Comments: Also register for a lecture & a lab
courses.Description: Third of a four course sequence teaching fundamental physics to engineering and science majors. courses.Title: General Psychology I
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for HSCI Majors

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychology of Sexual Behavior
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="254" dept="PSY" sect="040" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Computer-Assisted Data Analysis II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="PSY" sect="041" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychological Research I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="280" dept="PSY" sect="040" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides an introduction to the issues, techniques and methodologies associated with conducting psychological research. Topics to be covered include the logic of research in psychology, important issues in deciding how to study various psychological phenomena, ethical issues and guidelines in conducting psychological research, design and analysis of psychological research, assessing threats to internal and external validity, methods used in the interpretation of psychological data, and writing research reports in the style used by research psychologists.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: History and Systems of Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="290" dept="PSY" sect="040" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the historical foundations of modern psychology, with emphasis on the growth, contributions, and decline of major systems and theories.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychology of Learning
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="325" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces basic principles of the science of learning. Emphasizes I. P. Pavlov's classical conditioning, B. F. Skinner's operant conditioning, and applications to counseling and therapy.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Cognitive Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="PSY" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers human thought processes, including perception and pattern recognition, learning and memory, language, problem-solving, and decision-making.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Forensic Psychology
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="370" dept="PSY" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course describes the psychological processes involved in the legal system.  The material delves into the growing field of psychological study and application in the legal field.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Behavioral Neuroeconomics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Behavioral neuroeconomics is an emerging field of study that seeks to provide a single, generalizable theory of human decision making and predictable behavior. Behavioral neuroeconomics represents a convergence of neuroscience, psychology, sociology, and economics that is used to investigate and explain the effects of psychological, cognitive, emotional, cultural, and social factors on decisions, and their deviations from the rational. Behavioral neuroeconomics provides economists and social scientists with a deeper understanding of how decisions are made, how we create predictions, and how we judge probability. Neuroscience provides models and empirical evidence to understand social and economic behavior that relies on heuristics, framing, and market inefficiencies. This course will draw heavily on recent evidence from brain-imaging techniques, especially as they explain and expand on the models of Kahneman and Tversky.
