courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Industrial Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers theories, experiments, and problem-solving efforts of behavioral scientists in industrial settings for students interested in interpersonal relations, management, leadership, personnel, and applied psychology. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Death and Dying
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="252" dept="PSY" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores death and dying from various perspectives, including the philosophical, psychological, sociocultural, and personal.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Computer-Assisted Data Analysis II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="PSY" sect="040" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers more advanced statistical techniques, such as regression, correlation, analysis of variance, and multiple regression.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Computer-Assisted Data Analysis II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="265" dept="PSY" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers more advanced statistical techniques, such as regression, correlation, analysis of variance, and multiple regression.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychological Research I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="280" dept="PSY" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides an introduction to the issues, techniques and methodologies associated with conducting psychological research. Topics to be covered include the logic of research in psychology, important issues in deciding how to study various psychological phenomena, ethical issues and guidelines in conducting psychological research, design and analysis of psychological research, assessing threats to internal and external validity, methods used in the interpretation of psychological data, and writing research reports in the style used by research psychologists.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Educational Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="PSY" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers role and relevance of psychology in the teacher-learner relationship, with independent application of research techniques in an individual field study. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Cognitive Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers human thought processes, including perception and pattern recognition, learning and memory, language, problem-solving, and decision-making.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Experimental Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="360" dept="PSY" sect="040" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a study of the basic scientific fundamentals of the experiment with emphasis upon the critical thinking this method represents in establishing psychological principles. Contrasts are made to such modern pseudosciences as parapsychology. A final experiment is required of all students in this course. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychological Testing and Assessment
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="380" dept="PSY" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Enables the student to gain an understanding of the proper uses and applications of psychological evaluation by focusing on psychometric properties and reviewing selected tests and evaluation procedures commonly employed by psychologists in research and clinical practice.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Psychology Senior Thesis III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="492" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: An in-depth exploration of selected topics.  Projects are selected by students in consultation with a faculty member.   The students conduct these projects over the course of three terms in which they take PSY 490, 491, and 492. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Master's Thesis in Psychology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="898" dept="PSY" sect="NB2" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Requires supervised research at the master's level.

courses.Subject: PSY
courses.Title: Internship
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="999" dept="PSY" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides advanced, one-year full-time placement in a clinical setting determined by the clinical director and the student.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Introduction to Sociology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to what sociology is and what it studies. Topics will include socialization, group dynamics, gender roles, structural inequality, race and ethnic group relations, stratification, deviance, and population studies. Special attention will be paid to core social institutions (e.g. family, education, religion, political and economic systems) as well as theories and methods that guide sociological investigation.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Introduction to Sociology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="SOC" sect="004" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to what sociology is and what it studies. Topics will include socialization, group dynamics, gender roles, structural inequality, race and ethnic group relations, stratification, deviance, and population studies. Special attention will be paid to core social institutions (e.g. family, education, religion, political and economic systems) as well as theories and methods that guide sociological investigation.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Social Problems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="115" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a sociological analysis into the causes and possible cures for a variety of social problems. Focuses on topics such as unemployment, crime, poverty, corporate concentration of wealth and power, racism, immigration, health care, and environmental degradation.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of the Family
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="221" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines structure and functions of the family and the roles, relationships, problems, and opportunities of family living from a variety of perspectives. Uses lectures, field experiences, and discussion.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Gender and Society
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="230" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Explores the status and roles of modern women and men, with emphasis on changes in family relationships, career options, and lifestyle alternatives.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of Health and Illness
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="235" dept="SOC" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the history, economics, and politics of our health-care system and the effects of technology on the quality of health care.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of Sport
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="268" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course examines the cultural and social aspects of sport. Students will be introduced to sport as a ubiquitous institution in American society as well as the essential characteristics and functions of sport from both a sociological and historic perspective.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of Deviance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="320" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines theories of deviance and social control, focusing on their attribution of causation and the implications for control at both the individual and societal levels. Includes study of the social construction and maintenance of deviant identities and forms of deviance such as mental disorders, alcohol use, and crime.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Introduction to Sociology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="SOC" sect="003" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to what sociology is and what it studies. Topics will include socialization, group dynamics, gender roles, structural inequality, race and ethnic group relations, stratification, deviance, and population studies. Special attention will be paid to core social institutions (e.g. family, education, religion, political and economic systems) as well as theories and methods that guide sociological investigation.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Introduction to Sociology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="SOC" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to what sociology is and what it studies. Topics will include socialization, group dynamics, gender roles, structural inequality, race and ethnic group relations, stratification, deviance, and population studies. Special attention will be paid to core social institutions (e.g. family, education, religion, political and economic systems) as well as theories and methods that guide sociological investigation.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Race, Ethnicity and Social Inequality
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="210" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines cultural diversity, racial and ethnic identity; racism, discrimination and prejudice, as well as minority-majority group relations both globally and at home. Special attention will be paid to the history and present status of various major racial and ethnic groups in the United States including African Americans, Latinos, Asian Americans as well as "white" ethnicities.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sex and Society
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="222" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course examines how sexualities are socially produced and re-produced. Topics of study include gender and sexuality; changing social meanings of variant sexual orientations and practices; the effect of birth-control technologies, sexually transmitted infections and sexual violence on sexual norms; the commodification of sex and the social control of sex.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of Health and Illness
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="235" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the history, economics, and politics of our health-care system and the effects of technology on the quality of health care.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Research Methods I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers research design, measurement, sampling, survey research, field experiments, content analysis, interviewing techniques and ethics pertaining to research on human subjects. Prepares students to carry out simple empirical research projects as well as to become more sophisticated readers of sociological research.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Sociology of Aging
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="271" dept="SOC" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the multidisciplinary scientific study of the causes and consequences of aging, its history, methods of research, major theoretical approaches, and empirical findings.

courses.Subject: SOC
courses.Title: Classical Social Theory
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="355" dept="SOC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Critically examines the ideas of the classical sociological theorists (e.g., Marx, DuBois, Durkheim, and Weber). This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: UNIV
courses.Title: Looking Forward: Academics and Careers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="H201" dept="UNIV" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Just as UNIV 101 introduces students to the University and the major, UNIV 201 prepares students for their post-college future. Through developing a portfolio of work, creating reflections on the undergraduate experience and coop, learning about job and graduate school opportunities, and preparing for the senior year, students prepare for graduation and beyond.

courses.Subject: UNIV
courses.Title: Looking Forward: Academics and Careers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="S201" dept="UNIV" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Just as UNIV 101 introduces students to the University and the major, UNIV 201 prepares students for their post-college future. Through developing a portfolio of work, creating reflections on the undergraduate experience and coop, learning about job and graduate school opportunities, and preparing for the senior year, students prepare for graduation and beyond.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Creative Writing
courses.Section_Comments: Portions of this section are reserved for ENGL & SCRP majors
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="225" dept="WRIT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A workshop course in composing imaginative forms of personal expression, including poems, short stories, and personal essays. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Writing Fiction
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="302" dept="WRIT" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A creative writing workshop course focusing on fiction. Students read and write short stories. Students develop skills by creating complete fictional works and critiquing the work of other students. Emphasis placed on narrative structure, prose style, pacing, voice and tone, appropriate material, character, plot, description, dialogue, and editing.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Writing for Target Audiences
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="312" dept="WRIT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is structured as a writing workshop in which students will read and write in various rhetorical modes; emphasis is placed on experimenting with different forms such as review, proposal,and feature article writing as well as how to target various publications and therefore, various audiences. Students will read, discuss, and deconstruct published examples of many rhetorical modes, then write their own. Students will develop interview, review, research and persuasive writing skills.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Writing Poetry
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="301" dept="WRIT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A writing workshop in which students will read and write poetry; emphasis is placed on experimenting with different forms of poetry, editing, and manuscript preparations for publication. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Writing Humor and Comedy
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="303" dept="WRIT" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: A creative writing course focusing on humor and comedy. Students read and write satire, essays, social commentary and special forms. Students develop skills by creating complete works and critiquing the work of other students. Emphasis is placed on writing for specific audiences, narrative structure, prose style and editing.

courses.Subject: WRIT
courses.Title: Internship in Publishing
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="405" dept="WRIT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Internship in Publishing offers students practical experience in the publishing industry through the Drexel Publishing Group. Students work on The 33rd, (an academic journal); 5027mac.org (an online news and culture blog); and Painted Bride Quarterly (a literary magazine).

colleges.name: Bennett S. LeBow Coll. of Bus.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Accounting for Professionals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="110" dept="ACCT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course is open only to non-business students. A nontechnical introduction to the principles of financial and managerial accounting with emphasis on the use and interpretation of financial reports, managerial planning and control. The course would also provide an overview of business entities and taxation for businesses and individuals. The course is for the individual who seeks a basic knowledge of accounting and its uses. It is designed for the user of accounting information rather than the preparer. This course cannot be substituted for ACCT 115 or 116. Students graduating with a major in the School of Business cannot receive credit for this course.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Accounting for Professionals
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only

Students graduating with a major in the School of Business cannot receive credit for this course.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Financial Accounting Foundations
courses.Description: Introduces preparation of the income statement and the balance sheet. Covers analysis and recording of business transactions and a detailed study of accounting for assets, liabilities, and equity.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Managerial Accounting Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="116" dept="ACCT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the managerial accounting tools and models available for planning and projecting, controlling, and business analysis with an emphasis on decision-making. Covers budgeting, product costing, and analysis and projection of financial statements for internal purposes.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Managerial Accounting Foundations
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: Introduces the managerial accounting tools and models available for planning and projecting, controlling, and business analysis with an emphasis on decision-making. Covers budgeting, product costing, and analysis and projection of financial statements for internal purposes.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Financial Reporting II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="322" dept="ACCT" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Continues critical study of accounting theory and practice relating to financial statement items. The emphasis is on accounting principles underlying the measurement, recognition and reporting of long-lived tangible and intangible assets and long-term liabilities including bonds, pensions, and leases.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Cost Accounting
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="331" dept="ACCT" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Continues and expands the study of managerial accounting with an emphasis on cost accounting, internal reporting, analyzing accounting information for planning and projecting and making strategic short and long term business decisions through the use of case studies and/or projects.

courses.Subject: ACCT
courses.Title: Accounting Valuation Issues
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="628" dept="ACCT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores the role accounting information, accounting practices, and ratio analysis serves in determining the valuation of firm assets, liabilities and equity to support transactions such as asset impairment, mark-to-market accounting, business combinations or leveraged buyouts. Case studies will highlight current and emerging valuation issues and challenges.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Principles of Microeconomics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="ECON" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines allocation of resources within an economy. Major topics include interaction of supply and demand in markets, consumer choice, cost structure of firms, and profit maximization for competitive forms as well as firms with market power.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Principles of Macroeconomics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="202" dept="ECON" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines measurement, growth, and fluctuation of aggregate economic activity. Includes national income accounting and explains determination of output, employment, and price level. Also provides an introduction to international economics, money and banking, and economic policy. Some or all pre-requisites may be taken as either a pre-requisite or co-requisite. Please see the department for more information.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Economics of Health Care Systems
courses.Description: Examine the health care industry from an economic perspective, including demand, cost-benefit analysis, insurance, supply constraints, and the role of the government.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Economics of Small Business
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="260" dept="ECON" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Discusses economic topics relevant to the role and varieties of small businesses in industrialized economies, and to government policy with respect to small business.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Game Theory and Applications
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="250" dept="ECON" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces the basic ideas of game theory with a minimum of mathematics; and discuses application to economics, politics, business, behavioral science, philosophy, population biology and engineering.

courses.Subject: ECON
courses.Title: Economic Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="342" dept="ECON" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers topics including driving forces of economic growth, economic planning, income distribution and poverty, labor migration, capital markets and saving, international debt problems and global economic crisis. Emphasizes underlying theories and realities of economic growth and development of less developed economies and emerging economies.

courses.Subject: BUSN
courses.Title: Programming for Data Analytics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="360" dept="BUSN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The mission of this course is to immerse students in the technical challenges associated with contemporary data analytics as applied to business processes and data-driven decision making. To achieve this mission, the course will introduce modules covering the state-of-the-art in the areas of R programming as applied to data analysis for business problems.

courses.Subject: BUSN
courses.Title: Business Consulting Projects
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="715" dept="BUSN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed to give students an opportunity to work on a live project with a company in the region. The purpose of BCPs is to tackle real business issues, providing data and analysis in a concentrated timeframe. The student teams, with the support of advisors and faculty, will focus their energy on helping clients achieve new insights to business challenges.

courses.Subject: BUSN
courses.Title: Summer Research Activity for PHD Students
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="996" dept="BUSN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: During the Summer Quarters, PhD students in Business and Economics are expected to undertake research activity with a faculty mentor(s). This course is designated to record that activity during the summer quarter only. The research undertaken should advance the PhD student¿s research towards passing the candidacy exam requirements. This course is only open to PhD Students at LeBow including those in the School of Economics. The course is not open to PhD candidates or non-LeBow students.

courses.Subject: BUSN
courses.Title: Graduate Internship
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="615" dept="BUSN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Graduate-level internships provide an opportunity for practical application of theories learned in the classroom. Students typically spend three months employed at a business that is linked to their academic interests. Full-time employment is up to 40 hours/week while part-time employment is up to 20 hours/week. Variable credits based on duration of internship.

courses.Subject: BLAW
courses.Title: Aspects of Marketing Law
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="BLAW" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers many fundamental areas of marketing law, including: advertising and false/wrongful advertising; market shares and allocations; restraints of trade and other unfair competition under the antitrust laws; trademark protections and violations. Course applies as a Legal Studies Major and Minor requirement.

courses.Subject: MIS
courses.Title: Management Information Systems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="MIS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introductory course to Management of Information Systems, a core business function. The course examines how information systems (i.e., information technology, people, procedures, and data) help add value to an organization, and integrate the various functional areas of a business (e.g., accounting, marketing, etc.).

courses.Title: Management Information Systems
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: Introductory course to Management of Information Systems, a core business function. The course examines how information systems (i.e., information technology, people, procedures, and data) help add value to an organization, and integrate the various functional areas of a business (e.g., accounting, marketing, etc.).

courses.Subject: MIS
courses.Title: Domestic and Global Outsourcing Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="347" dept="MIS" sect="130" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: To introduce the student to issues in managing the outsourcing of Information Systems. This will be done in a mixture of lectures and student team presentations. The lectures will introduce the students to some of the central themes of outsourcing IS by summarizing current literature. Parallel to these lectures students will form study teams to investigate other important topics of IS outsourcing through a guided literature reading.

courses.Subject: MIS
courses.Title: Systems Analysis & Design
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="624" dept="MIS" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines concepts of the information systems development lifecycle and methods for analyzing user information requirements. Focuses on structured techniques for designing a system, managing its development and testing, performing feasibility analyses, and ensuring both user satisfaction and achievement of functional requirements. Covers techniques such as rapid application development (RAD), prototyping, and joint analysis and design (JAD) in detail. Also covers techniques such as data flow diagramming, logical database design, and user interface design.

courses.Title: Database Design and Implementation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="343" dept="MIS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers data and file structures, object-oriented database design, and the use of SQL for querying databases. Discusses logical and physical database design and offers hands-on experience with commercial database management systems (DBMSs).

courses.Subject: OPM
courses.Title: Operations Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="OPM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides students with an understanding of the transformation process, which converts inputs into outputs. This is the primary function of every manufacturing/service organization, and how it adds value to the outputs. Discusses the decision-making process and techniques for planning and controlling the operations function.

courses.Subject: OPM
courses.Title: Service Operations Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="315" dept="OPM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Analyze service systems from the viewpoint of the operations manager to understand where and in what ways the body of knowledge developed in operations management, strategy, and marketing can be applied and where other approaches are necessary. Focus on understanding what customers want, designing systems and procedures delivering services, and controlling quality.

courses.Subject: OPM
courses.Title: Advanced Planning and Control of Operations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="325" dept="OPM" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on the medium to short-term managerial decision processes and models within the realm of the operations function of manufacturing and service organizations.  Topics covered include time series forecasting, aggregate planning, materials management, operations and staff scheduling, and statistical quality control.

courses.Subject: ORGB
courses.Title: Organizational Behavior
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="300" dept="ORGB" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides conceptual understanding of various principles of management and organizational processes and the opportunity for skill-building in the areas of individual, interpersonal, and intergroup organizational behaviors. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ORGB
courses.Title: Organizational Behavior
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: Provides conceptual understanding of various principles of management and organizational processes and the opportunity for skill-building in the areas of individual, interpersonal, and intergroup organizational behaviors. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: ORGB
courses.Title: Strategic Career Development
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: This course provides a conceptual understanding of career management and a practical application of this material to the career decisions that students currently face and will face in the future. A blend of theory, case analysis, and self-assessments relate course concepts to effective techniques for managing a career at different phases of life.

courses.Subject: ORGB
courses.Title: Career and Professional Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="530" dept="ORGB" sect="604" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: To be an effective leader and to develop professionally, individuals must understand themselves, exercise self-leadership, and manage their careers and lives effectively. This course helps students develop knowledge and skills in these areas to enhance their professional development and to become effective managers of their careers. Using readings, cases, self-assessments, and discussions, the objective of the course is to provide students with opportunities to understand trends in contemporary organizations and careers, enhance their self-awareness, develop career self-management skills, and apply these skills and perspectives to further their professional development.

courses.Subject: ORGB
courses.Title: Negotiations for Leaders
courses.Description: This course is designed specifically for leaders to enhance their leadership negotiation style.  The material is geared toward developing leaders as they deal with the art and science of securing agreements and resolving disputes.  The course combines a theoretical understanding of the central concepts of negotiations with learned analytical skills to discover optimal solutions to problems (the science) and good negotiation skills to get these solutions accepted and implemented (the art).

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: The Business of Sport
courses.Description: This course will introduce students to the billion-dollar international sports industry and identify the vast, creative, and substantial role business plays in professional, collegiate and amateur sports. Sports business applications are explored in the following areas: sponsorship, promotions, marketing, fundraising, finance, media, ticketing, public relations, law, facilities, and sport careers.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: The Business of Sport
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: This course will introduce students to the billion-dollar international sports industry and identify the vast, creative, and substantial role business plays in professional, collegiate and amateur sports. Sports business applications are explored in the following areas: sponsorship, promotions, marketing, fundraising, finance, media, ticketing, public relations, law, facilities, and sport careers.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: International Aspects of Sport
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: Continuing with the true spirit of the Olympic Games, sports can be a rich avenue for building an international community. This course compares and contrasts how sports are perceived, organized, and played in many countries. It examines the social, political, and economic aspects of sports in other countries. Students will learn about major international sporting events. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: Sports Industry Practicum
courses.Description: The practicum is designed to develop greater breadth and depth of students' understanding and experience within the industry. The practical application of knowledge and skill acquired in class will help students extend their expertise by working in a sport management related organization. Suggested for non-co-op students.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: Sports Industry Practicum
courses.Description: The practicum is designed to develop greater breadth and depth of student's understanding and experience within the industry. The practical application of the knowledge and skill acquired in classes will help students to extend their expertise by working in a sport management related organization.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: Sport Ticket Sales
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="362" dept="SMT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides training in all aspects of ticket sales including networking, prospecting and qualifying, creating sales proposals, overcoming objections, and closing sales. Specific techniques such as role playing will be used to prepare students for careers in sport ticket sales.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: Managing Coaches & Teams
courses.Description: Course will include setting performance goals in coaching, the various roles of the coach, ethical conduct in coaching, coach-athlete compatibility, burnout, personality of the coach and coaching youth sports. Emphasis will be placed on how administrators can best manage coaches for continued athletic program success.

courses.Subject: SMT
courses.Title: Gender Equity in High School & College Sports
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="648" dept="SMT" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed to provide students with the opportunity to about the impact Title IX and other gender equity laws have had in shaping high school and college athletic programs. Consideration is given to the challenges associated with achieving equity in a system that is sex-segregated.

courses.Title: Career Management

courses.Subject: STAT
courses.Title: Introduction to Business Statistics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="STAT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This introductory first course in business statistics focuses on applications of data analysis and statistics in business and economics. Topics covered include descriptive statistics and graphical presentation, probability, statistical inference, and simple regression analysis.

courses.Subject: STAT
courses.Title: Introduction to Business Statistics
courses.Description: This introductory first course in business statistics focuses on applications of data analysis and statistics in business and economics. Topics covered include descriptive statistics and graphical presentation, probability, statistical inference, and simple regression analysis.

courses.Subject: STAT
courses.Title: Business Statistics II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="202" dept="STAT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This second course in business statistics focuses on widely used data analysis techniques in business and economics. Topics include two sample procedures, categorical data analysis, analysis of variance, regression analysis and other statistical applications as time permits. Applications are covered through practical data analysis examples.

courses.Subject: STAT
courses.Title: Introduction to Data Mining for Business
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="331" dept="STAT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course introduces students to the fundamental ideas of data mining methods, including dimension reduction, cluster, classification and regression trees, and logistic regression. The emphasis is understanding the application of methods rather than on mathematical and computational foundations. All applications are business-oriented.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Introduction to Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="301" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers financial structure of a corporation, short-and long-term financial policies, sources and uses of capital funds, asset valuation, capital budgeting, and corporate growth.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Intermediate Corporate Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="302" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an in-depth treatment of long-term financing decisions, including estimation of the cost of capital, financial leverage, dividend policy, and working capital analysis.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Financial Institutions and Markets
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="325" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers understanding of the financial system from the money-creation process to the functioning of the Federal Reserve System to the role and management of financial institutions.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Money and Capital Markets
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="338" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers the organization and operation of the money and capital markets and key institutional financial intermediaries.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Corporate Financial Management
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="601" dept="FIN" sect="922" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The objective of this course is to develop the intuition and tools to analyze corporate financial decisions. The topics to be covered include the time value of money, capital budgeting, stock and bond valuation, the link between risk and return, the cost of capital, and business valuation.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Financial Institutions & Markets
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="622" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Analyzes the economic functions of financial markets and intermediaries. Examines monetary policy formation and its impact on financial markets.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Introduction to Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="301" dept="FIN" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers financial structure of a corporation, short-and long-term financial policies, sources and uses of capital funds, asset valuation, capital budgeting, and corporate growth.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Investment Securities & Markets
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="321" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers stocks, bonds, other investment vehicles, and operation and regulation of the stock market.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Entrepreneurial Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="335" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The purpose of the course is to bring financial management decision, tools and techniques typically applied in corporate contexts into the realm of entrepreneurship. This course presents the importance of understanding and applying entrepreneurial finance methods and tools to help ensure a successful venture.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Corporate Financial Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="601" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The objective of this course is to develop the intuition and tools to analyze corporate financial decisions. The topics to be covered include the time value of money, capital budgeting, stock and bond valuation, the link between risk and return, the cost of capital, and business valuation.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Advanced Financial Management
courses.Description: Provides an in-depth treatment of long-term financing decisions, including estimation of the cost of capital, financial leverage, dividend policy, and capital structure determination.

courses.Subject: FIN
courses.Title: Dissertation Research in Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="998" dept="FIN" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: INTB
courses.Title: International Business
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="INTB" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course examines economic, political, legal, and social factors affecting formulation of international business strategy.

courses.Subject: INTB
courses.Title: International Money and Finance
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="336" dept="INTB" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines major issues in international finance and open-economy macroeconomics. Develops models of international monetary interdependence and applies them to real-world examples. Covers determinants of interest rates, balance of payments, international macro policy, restructuring the international monetary system, and globalization of financial markets.

courses.Subject: INTB
courses.Title: International Business
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="200" dept="INTB" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course examines economic, political, legal, and social factors affecting formulation of international business strategy.

courses.Subject: INTB
courses.Title: Seminar in International Business
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="790" dept="INTB" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Requires students to present the results of research on the application of theory to contemporary economic, political, and social problems as they affect U.S. business operations abroad. Requires oral presentation and written report of graduate quality.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Introduction to Technology Innovation Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="MGMT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course discusses the basics every manager needs to organize successful technology-driven innovation in both entrepreneurial and established firms. We start by examining innovation-based strategies as a source of competitive advantage and then examine how to build organizations that excel at identifying, building and commercializing technological innovations.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Introduction to Entrepreneurship
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="260" dept="MGMT" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course focuses on entrepreneurship as a generic activity, including start-ups and corporate entrepreneurship. It explores the opportunities and challenges faced by individuals starting up new ventures and the probable paths of career development for the students pursuing entrepreneurship.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Business Plan for Entrepreneurs
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Description: In this course, students learn how to prepare a comprehensive strategy for launching a new business.  The vehicle for achieving this is the preparation of a start-up business plan based on a selected opportunity.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Strategy and Competitive Advantage
courses.Description: Provides an integrated approach to business planning. Develops strategic analysis and decision-making through examination of an organization's internal and external environment. Requires written and oral case reports.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Business Problem Solving
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="510" dept="MGMT" sect="922" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Decision-making and problem-solving prowess is a skill that can and should be learned. Why do well-intentioned, smart, experienced professionals make poor decisions far too often? It may be because they haven¿t been taught a disciplined process for making quality decisions. Perhaps they¿ve relied on intuition, brains, luck, common sense, and training within the narrow bounds of their professional expertise. Unfortunately, in today¿s professional environment these attributes may not be enough to sustain advantage. This course will help managers build confidence in the quality of their complex problem solving and decision making abilities, making them better leaders, and preparing them for effectively solving future challenges.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Strategy Analysis
courses.Description: Strategy Analysis will help you understand the fundamental question: Why do some firms perform better than others? Strategy Analysis will offer you the frameworks and tools necessary to assemble and analyze information required to arrive at the answer to the fundamental question.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: New Venture Planning
courses.Section_Comments: Online exams are proctored. Details at lebow.me/exams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="652" dept="MGMT" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students draw on their entire business education and practical experience and bring it to bear upon a plan for launching a new venture. Working in small teams, students research a new project or service; prepare marketing, sales and operation plans; and make financial plans.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Leading for Innovation
courses.Section_Comments: This Residency course will take place June 27-June 30, 2019
courses.Description: This course is presented and delivered by LeBow's Centers of Excellence. The course integrates the thought leadership of our Centers. Through an experiential learning platform, the course will focus on the way leaders, both entrepreneurs and executives, need to innovate as they lead their businesses for value creation.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Strategy Implementation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="686" dept="MGMT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on the frameworks and tools necessary and often used in strategy implementation. The course will stress the need to tailor an implementation approach to be aligned with the intended strategy, and responsive to external stakeholders, both shareholders, customers and others. In successive sessions, the course will focus on rational components of execution such as structure and reward systems, and the human components such as culture, networks and power. The distinct roles of top management and middle management will be illustrated, and examples will include both single industry and diversified firms.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: MBA Capstone
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="770" dept="MGMT" sect="604" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This core course will provide a student with an exposure to integrated decision making situation from the CEO¿s perspective. This course will enable students to appreciate the complexities of formulating and solving complex business problems. We will also discuss how the ¿soft¿ side of things effect business performance. Finally, unlike the analytic focus of strategy analysis, the students will be forced to think through specific action plans and implementation.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Dissertation Research in Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="998" dept="MGMT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Business Ethics
courses.Description: Presents several frameworks by which to view ethics and decision-making. Links theory and practice through the study of business ethics as it relates to a variety of management issues. Focuses on the individual, the organization, and the system. Includes case studies, field work, readings, and interaction with visiting guest lecturers.

courses.Subject: MGMT
courses.Title: Leading for Innovation
courses.Section_Comments: This Residency course will be held at our Malvern Campus.
courses.Description: This course is presented and delivered by LeBow's Centers of Excellence. The course integrates the thought leadership of our Centers. Through an experiential learning platform, the course will focus on the way leaders, both entrepreneurs and executives, need to innovate as they lead their businesses for value creation.

Finally, unlike the analytic focus of strategy analysis, the students will be forced to think through specific action plans and implementation.

courses.Subject: MKTG
courses.Title: Introduction to Marketing Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="MKTG" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides a conceptual and applications-oriented framework for marketing decision-making in a dynamic environment. Emphasizes satisfying target customers and achieving organizational objectives through skillful blending of strategies in product development, pricing, promotion, and distribution.

courses.Subject: MKTG
courses.Title: Introduction to Marketing Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="MKTG" sect="062" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Emphasizes satisfying target customers and achieving organizational objectives through skillful blending of strategies in product development, pricing, promotion, and distribution.
