courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Chemical Engineering Thermodynamics I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="230" dept="CHE" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: First and second laws of thermodynamics, use of state functions to solve macroscopic problems, distinction between solving ideal gas and real fluid problems. An introduction to phase equilibrium and mixtures. Concepts of fugacity and activity as measures of nonideality.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Process Modeling II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="308" dept="CHE" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers mathematical modeling of chemical and biochemical processes such as chemical and biochemical reactors and heating and cooling systems, analytical methods for solving algebraic and ordinary-differential equations.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="334" dept="CHE" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Offers laboratory experiments illustrating the fundamentals of chemical engineering process analysis. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="334" dept="CHE" sect="A" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Offers laboratory experiments illustrating the fundamentals of chemical engineering process analysis. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Heat Transfer
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="342" dept="CHE" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers, as a continuation of transport phenomena and within the context of processes, transfer of energy by conduction, convection, and radiation and design of heat exchangers.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Mass Transfer
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="343" dept="CHE" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers, within the context of processes previously introduced, mass transfer in mixtures; diffusion, convection, and continuation of transport phenomena; component separation in continuous contactors; gas absorption; liquid-liquid extraction; and simultaneous heat and mass transfer.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Chemical Engineering Laboratory I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="351" dept="CHE" sect="062" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Offers laboratory experience in chemical engineering processes, requiring both experimental design and analysis. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: CHE
courses.Title: Integrated Case Studies in Chemical Engineering
courses.Instructor: John H Speidel, David M Kolesar
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="372" dept="CHE" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course reviews selected cases (market, processes, equipment sets and incidents) from chemical engineering practice whose analysis requires integration of concepts from previous Chemical Engineering courses such as mass and energy transport, thermodynamics, separations and reaction engineering.

courses.Subject: CAEE
courses.Title: System Balances and Design in CAEE
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="203" dept="CAEE" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Based on fundamental science and mathematics preparation, this course for students in Civil, Architectural and Environmental Engineering covers delineation of system boundaries, analysis of mass, energy and force balances that support system integration; life cycle and uncertainty analysis; and formulation of problem solutions using these balances.

courses.Subject: ECEC
courses.Title: Design with Microcontrollers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="204" dept="ECEC" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Offers hands-on experience in the design of controllers that incorporate microcontrollers as an embedded component in a larger system. The microcomputer topics to be studied will include architecture, software, programming and interfaces.

courses.Subject: ECEC
courses.Title: Design with Microcontrollers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="204" dept="ECEC" sect="A" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Title: Design with Microcontrollers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="204" dept="ECEC" sect="062" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: ECEC
courses.Title: Computer Organization & Architecture
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="355" dept="ECEC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will cover the principles of designing microprocessors using solid engineering fundamentals and quantitative cost/performance trade-offs.  Topics will cover instruction set architectures, arithmetic for computers, assessing and understanding processor performance, processor datapath and control, pipelining, cache design, and virtual-memory design.

courses.Subject: ECEP
courses.Title: Electric Motor Control Principles
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="352" dept="ECEP" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces machinery principles, magnetic circuits, three-phase circuits, the electrical and economic structure of the power industry, ac and dc machine fundamentals, and power electronic converters and their interfaces with electric motors. Some or all pre-requisites may be taken as either a pre-requisite or co-requisite. Please see the department for more information.

courses.Title: Electric Motor Control Principles

courses.Description: Covers basic electric circuit concepts and laws; circuit theorems; mesh and node methods; analysis of first-order electric circuits; forced and natural response; sinusoidal steady state analysis; complex frequency.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Analysis and Decision Methods for Technical Managers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="502" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course will develop a framework that can be used to effectively manage organizations for sustainable high performance. It will build on the fundamentals that were learned in Engineering Management I and explore concepts related to change, strategy, culture, complexity, systems thinking, learning, creativity, problem solving, and innovation. Upon completing the course the student will have an enhanced ability to bring creativity to management and leadership challenges as well as an appreciation of the processes, skills, and attitude needed for success.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Financial Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="535" dept="EGMT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Studies the features of accounting data essential to the interpretation and evaluation of engineering operations and financial position of the engineering enterprise. Analyzes financial statements and reports from the point of view of management.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Engineering Statistics
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="571" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers probability, including random variables and probability distributions, mathematical expectation, discrete probability distributions, continuous probability distributions, sampling and sampling distribution, and estimators and confidence intervals. Includes applications to engineering and industrial problems.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Operations Research
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="573" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers deterministic modeling, including linear programming; the Simplex Method; theory of the Simplex Method; duality and sensitivity analysis; transportation, transshipment, and assignment problems; problem formulation; goal programming; network analysis; dynamic programming; and integer and non-linear programming. Discusses case study applications of engineering and management problems.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Visual System Mapping
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="635" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Visual System Mapping is an elective course designed to unlock creativity used to solve problems, accelerate learning and improve communications. Application of VSM techniques provides an advantage to solution development, collaboration and consensus in business problems for success in today¿s highly complex and competitive environment. VSM was inspired by a technique known as "Mind Mapping, and was designed to improve the use of the brain in learning and mastery and has been demonstrated to lead to enhanced creativity and better results. Practitioners can expect to have fun while virtually guaranteeing breakthrough outcomes. This course allows students to learn techniques and methods and apply them to personal, professional and organizational issues on individual and team projects.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Design Thinking for Engineering Communications
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="504" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Teaches effective communication skills, both written and spoken, and strategies essential for success in the workplace. Addresses interpersonal issues, communicating across functional disciplines. Uses the Design Approach. Addresses the communication demands of engineers.

courses.Subject: EGMT
courses.Title: Project Planning, Scheduling and Control
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="625" dept="EGMT" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides a basic understanding of project planning and control by examining concepts and theories.  Emphasis is placed on planning and control of technology based organizations.  Upon successful completion of this course, students should be able to use the tools and concepts of project control and apply them.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="231" dept="ENGR" sect="A" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an overview of systems and modeling; specifically using linear algebra as the model.  Specific emphasis will be placed on developing models of engineering systems and the use of computational tools for solutions of the problems.  The focus of the lab will be the use of MATLAB for solution of contemporary engineering problems.

courses.Subject: ENGR
courses.Title: Dynamic Engineering Systems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="232" dept="ENGR" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides an overview of dynamic systems and modeling; specifically using differential equations as a model.  Specific emphasis will be placed on developing models of dynamic systems and the use of computational tools for solutions of the problems.  The focus of the lab will be the use of MATLAB for solution of contemporary engineering problems.

courses.Subject: ENGR
courses.Title: Dynamic Engineering Systems
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="232" dept="ENGR" sect="063" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="232" dept="ENGR" sect="065" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

Specific emphasis will be placed on developing models of dynamic systems and the use of computational tools for solutions of the problems.  The focus of the lab will be the use of MATLAB for solution of contemporary engineering problems.

courses.Subject: MATE
courses.Title: Introduction to Mechanical Behavior of Materials
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="221" dept="MATE" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers mechanics of materials, materials under load, application to materials testing, rate-dependent response to materials, fracture materials, fatigue behavior, manufacturing, and materials processing.

courses.Subject: PROJ
courses.Title: Project Planning & Scheduling
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="502" dept="PROJ" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will prepare students to master concepts in project planning, scheduling and control. Project scheduling methods are covered including: critical path systems, critical chain scheduling, statistical analysis, Program Evaluation Review Technique, linear resource leveling, and legal ramifications on contracted projects.

courses.Subject: PROJ
courses.Title: Managing Multiple Projects
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="530" dept="PROJ" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the complex and simultaneous management principles and techniques required to manage multiple projects. Emphasis is placed on a theory and practice of project management that is rigorous and disciplined, yet flexible.

courses.Subject: PROJ
courses.Title: Project Quality Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="510" dept="PROJ" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Quality management is related to project management. Examines basic quality concepts and explores the three sub-processes of quality management: quality planning, quality assurance, and quality control as they relate to project management.

courses.Subject: PROJ
courses.Title: Project Procurement Management
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="540" dept="PROJ" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines role of procurement in project management including processes and activities needed to acquire products, services and results required to accomplish a project from outside the project organization. Planning, conducting administering and closing procurements are course components as are relevant legal and ethical issues, contract capacity, authority, public and private bidding processes and dispute resolution methods.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Systems Reliability Engineering
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="523" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course focuses in modeling and analysis of systems reliability using probability models. The primary reason for modeling reliability systems is to improve the reliability and availability of a product or a system.  The course covers three major aspects of reliability: reliability models, analysis of failure and repair distributions, and finally preventive maintenance and warranty models. Upon completion of the course, students will be able to apply reliability models for a product or system during its life-cycle: design, production, and warranty.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Systems Integration and Test
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="533" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The systems engineering process applies well tested engineering practices to address the processes which are critical to most large engineering efforts, and optimizing them for effectiveness and financial success.  The process covers the complete engineering system evolution from needs and requirements generation to production and construction and operation.  Throughout the systems engineering process, various disciplines of engineering as well as various forms of information and technology need to be integrated, and the effectiveness of each step of the process ascertained.  This course will address the processes, methods, and tools to integrate, test and evaluate the myriad of engineering information, technology, and products that are encountered throughout the systems engineering process.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Naval Engr for 21st Century
courses.Instructor: Carlo S Ciliberti, John A Fekete
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T680" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course serves as an introduction to the theory and design of engineering machinery and equipment aboard modern ships. Primary emphasis is placed on helping the student acquire an overall view of the development, design, construction and operation of ships and weapon systems and an understanding of the mechanical systems encountered onboard navy ships. An emphasis will be placed on the propulsion and auxiliary systems for conventional and nuclear steam propulsion, gas turbine power plants and internal combustion engines.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Systems Architecture Development
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="531" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: System architecture development is the most important activity in a complex system solution: pick the wrong architecture and the final system may not work, be overcome by displacement technology, or never be implemented because of cost, complexity, or other issues. Course Topics include architecture frameworks, architecture drivers, selection criteria, depiction, generic alternatives, trade studies, architecture selection, open closed architectures, vendor independence and technology choices, and architecture information products.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Capstone in Systems Engineering
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="598" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The capstone course is completed independently or within a group class setting over a full quarter term. The capstone course is the culmination of the student¿s academic and professional experience, and it will be completed under the direction of a Systems Engineering faculty member. Over the course of the term, students will apply the knowledge gained during their tenure in the program to create a Capstone Project. This project will integrate the skills necessary for analyzing issues, thinking creatively, working collaboratively, and presenting impactful ideas. The Capstone Project should be one of the most comprehensive and applied works a student completes in his or her academic career.

courses.Subject: SYSE
courses.Title: Systems Engineering Analysis
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="688" dept="SYSE" sect="911" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduces multiple System Engineering Analysis practices used to execute systems engineering processes. Provides foundation to execute, monitor, and manage the traditional practices and also develops ability to modify and establish new practices based on this massive foundation. Instills confidence so student can contribute, lead, monitor or manage any systems effort.

courses.Subject: CHP
courses.Title: Overview of Maternal and Child Health
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="517" dept="CHP" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers key principles and methods of maternal and child health (MCH) using a public health lens. This course will look at key points in the reproductive cycle, to include family planning, prenatal health, birth and the postpartum period; and then explore child health, to include infant and child morbidity and mortality, child development, LGBT health issues, and children and youth with special health care needs. The course will introduce common environmental and occupational exposures of women, fetuses, infants and children and discuss exposure prevention interventions.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Public Health 101
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="101" dept="PBHL" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Introduction to Public Health is a broad overview class designed to give an introduction to the core tenets of Public Health. Basic concepts covered in the class are the basic definitions and concepts related to public health. Specific areas that will be further explored in the class include, what it means to be healthy, what is public health, what are social determinants of health, what is disease prevention and health promotion and what are health inequalities among others.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Public Health Leadership
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="315" dept="PBHL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides students with an introduction to the environment and organizations in public health leadership. This course introduces leadership skills to lead changes in public health organizations. The cases and lectures throughout the course have been designed to develop leadership approaches for public health agencies.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Violence and Trauma in Public Health
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="318" dept="PBHL" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on the public health policy and practice aspects of trauma violence and adversity. The course will begin by laying a foundation of trauma theory and then will examine the impact of emerging knowledge on individuals, communities and systems. The course will examine trauma informed models, which have been applied to individuals, communities and systems and will analyze the policy and practice implications of these models as well as the translation from research to practice.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Introduction to Public Health
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="501" dept="PBHL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The purpose of this course is to provide a broad introduction to public health, as well as an understanding about how specialized health research contribute to achieving the goals of public health.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Women and Children: Health & Society
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="305" dept="PBHL" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed to give students a broad overview of pertinent issues surrounding the health and well being of mothers and children.  The course emphasizes the inter-relationship among women's health, reproductive health and child health.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: The World's Water
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="317" dept="PBHL" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will discuss the approaches that may be taken to improve access to water and sanitation and improve public health. The course will also cover water remediation and safeguard techniques for the improvement of water quality, as well as gender and development perspectives.

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Happiness 101
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="PBHL" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Living a Life of Meaning: Happiness 101

courses.Subject: PBHL
courses.Title: Global Health Integration Module and Field Practicum Experience
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="708" dept="PBHL" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will provide students with a distributed and evaluated global health training experience that requires students to synthesize and integrate knowledge acquired in coursework and other learning experiences and apply theory and principles in a situation that approximates some aspect of professional practice in global health and international development. Students will be mentored through the experience by faculty members, and will complete online modules as well as a 2-3 week field practicum (80-120 hours as part of a ¿summer institute¿) working closely with preceptors from partnering NGOs, international agencies, Ministries of Health and foreign institutions in the global health practice setting.

courses.Subject: EPI
courses.Title: Design and Analysis of Epidemiological Studies
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="572" dept="EPI" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will demonstrate the applicability of the goals and approaches from descriptive and analytical methods in biostatistics and epidemiology courses to real world problems. The project will provide the student with the opportunity to use methods in an area of their choice.

courses.Subject: CULA
courses.Title: Culinary Arts Practicum II
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students in on-campus programs only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="291" dept="CULA" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Students will gain work experience in culinary production while under faculty supervision. Students obtain industry jobs, work a minimum of 120 hours, log their experiences, and write a final analysis. The networking opportunities often lead to rewarding co-op, part time, or full time employment opportunities. Students take either CULA 290 or CULA 291.

courses.Subject: CULA
courses.Title: The Kitchen Garden: Summer
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="426" dept="CULA" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course familiarizes students with the dynamics of the contemporary kitchen garden as a food source, and a platform for environmental stewardship. Students will study the importance of plant nutrition; and take part in community garden outreach activities. The harvested summer produce is used in summer term Culinary Arts classes.

courses.Subject: GSTD
courses.Title: Professional Applications of Emotional Intelligence
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="GSTD" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will examine emotional intelligence as applied through interpersonal communication. Particular emphasis will be placed on emotional intelligence in the workplace and in leadership. The main objective is to make students aware that intelligence and technological expertise are not enough to be successful in the workplace. This is a writing intensive course.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Computer Applications for Professionals
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="211" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Through lecture-demonstrations, hands-on labs, independent study assignments, and case study analysis, students are challenged to use critical-thinking, data analysis and problem-solving techniques to develop cost-efficient and effective solutions to realistic professional problems using computer-based business application software.  Students should possess a basic level of computer proficiency before taking this course.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Workplace Divert & Inclusio
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T380" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Policy Analysis
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="640" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course analyzes the entire process of policy agenda-setting, initiation, decision-making, implementation, evaluation and assessment.  Students will be equipped with tools to analyze and understand the entire process of policy formation in any public or private enterprise.  The skills developed in the course can be used in many professional fields.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Fostering Diversity and Inclus
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="T780" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Topics decided upon by faculty will vary within the area of study.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Interpersonal Skills for Virtual Teams
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="303" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will introduce students to the dynamics of virtual teamwork and will allow students to experience first-hand the opportunities and challenges associated with operating in a virtual environment.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Policy Analysis
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="440" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course analyzes the entire process of policy agenda-setting, initiation, decision-making, implementation, evaluation and assessment.  Students will be equipped with tools to analyze and understand the entire process of policy formation in any public or private enterprise.  The skills developed in this course can be used in many professional fields.

courses.Subject: PRST
courses.Title: Capstone II: Topical Analysis
courses.Instructor: Anne C Willkomm, Giuseppe J Salomone
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="701" dept="PRST" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The second of a two-course sequence allows students to integrate skills and knowledge learned in the classroom with his/her experience to research and report on a specific professional area of interest. Students will demonstrate their learned skills in communication, leadership, critical inquiry, and ethics, as well as speak in some manner to the student's professional development aspirations.

courses.Subject: NPM
courses.Title: Nonprofit Workshop I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="600" dept="NPM" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: In this workshop-based course, students will work directly with a nonprofit organization to study, solve, or create an action plan for a particular generalized need as identified by the nonprofit. Students will build upon early foundational knowledge while developing hands-on experience in a safe setting guided by the faculty member. Through reflective work, students will learn to assess their own work and ultimately identify their own strengths and weaknesses to target areas for continued growth.

courses.Subject: MLSC
courses.Title: Leadership in Changing Environments
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="220" dept="MLSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Examines the challenges of leading in complex contemporary operational environments. Students/cadets are exposed to more complex land navigation/map reading tasks, as well as more advanced small unit operations/ leadership drills. Cadets develop greater self awareness as they practice communication and team building skills.

courses.Subject: MLSC
courses.Title: Leadership Lab/Practicum
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="303" dept="MLSC" sect="101" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides hands-on experience to reinforce leadership fundamentals, while emphasizing increased awareness of and proficiency in military skills.

courses.Subject: MLSC
courses.Title: Military Leadership Co-op Preparation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="330" dept="MLSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Continues the methodology of MLSC 320 by using increasingly intense situational leadership challenges to build cadet awareness and skills in leading small units.  Skills in decision-making, persuading, and motivating team members when "in combat" are explored, evaluated, and developed.  Emphasis is also placed on honing oral and written communication skills and mastering group dynamics while conducting tactical and Garrison operation orders.

courses.Subject: MLSC
courses.Title: Leadership Lab/Practicum
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="301" dept="MLSC" sect="101" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Provides hands-on experience to reinforce leadership fundamentals, while emphasizing increased awareness of and proficiency in military skills.

courses.Subject: MLSC
courses.Title: Leadership in Contact
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="310" dept="MLSC" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Uses increasingly intense situational leadership challenges to build cadet awareness and skills in leading small units.  Skills in decision-making, persuading, and motivating team members when "in combat" are explored, evaluated, and developed.

courses.Subject: GES
courses.Title: Global Engagement Scholar Colloquium
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students on-campus and online.
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="GES" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The Global Engagement Scholar (GES) Colloquium course is a requirement for all students seeking the GES designation. This non-credit repeatable colloquium provides structure and guidance to students allowing them to track completion of the GES designation requirements. In addition to serving as a tool for tracking all of the global experiences that students have at Drexel, the course will have required and optional reflections, discussions and activities in preparation for the creation of an electronic portfolio(GES401). GES is free and open to all qualified undergraduate students. Students who complete all of the GES requirements will receive a designation on their transcript. This course will serve as an important tool for  demonstrating Global Competence, one of Drexel Student Learning Priorities (DSLPs).

courses.Subject: GES
courses.Title: Global Engagement Scholar Program Portfolio
courses.Section_Comments: Open to students on-campus and online.
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="401" dept="GES" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This portfolio course is the final requirement for the Global Engagement Scholar (GES) program.  The GES program is free and open to all Drexel undergraduate students who are interested in becoming globally minded citizens.  For more information about the GES program, please visit: www.drexel.edu/internatonal.  Only those students who have already completed the GES program activities are eligible for GES401. This non-credit portfolio course provides structure and guidance to students as they collect, connect,  and reflect on their global experiences at Drexel through the creation of an electronic portfolio package.  The portfolio will serve as an important tool for students to demonstrate their Global Competence, one of the Drexel Student Learning Priorities (DSLPs).

courses.Subject: ANAT
courses.Title: Anatomy & Physiology III
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="103" dept="ANAT" sect="060" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is a continuation of ANAT 101 & 102. This course is a general study of the structures and physiology of the human body. Fundamental concepts of microscopic tissue structure, gross structures of organs and body system organization are taught. The course consists of both lab and lecture material. The lecture deals with the general principles. While in the lab, the student participates with practical examination of microscopic sections, tissues, organs and the anatomical layout of various animal cadavers. The cardiovascular, lymphatic, respiratory, urinary and reproductive systems will be covered.

courses.Title: Anatomy & Physiology III

courses.Subject: ANAT
courses.Title: Advanced Anatomy II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="421" dept="ANAT" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is a continuation of ANAT 420. Emphasis is placed on the regional study of the thorax, abdomen, pelvis and lower extremity. Laboratory material include human cadavers, models, radiographs, CT scans, MRI images and relevant web sites.

courses.Subject: BMES
courses.Title: Laboratory V: Musculoskeletal Anatomy for Biomedical Engineers
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="305" dept="BMES" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides an opportunity for students to study the anatomy and biomechanics of select articulations of the human body.  While the main emphasis will be on the musculoskeletal structures associated with each articulation, major neural and vascular structures will be studied as well.

courses.Subject: CFTP
courses.Title: Family Life Cycle
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="520" dept="CFTP" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course integrates the interface of individual development with the social structure of coupling and family in family life cycle framework.

courses.Subject: CFTP
courses.Title: Research I: Family Evaluation
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="524" dept="CFTP" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on issues in the clinical assessment of individuals, couples, and families.  Assessment will be considered through a multi-method approach that includes:  qualitative interview, observational, clinician-rated or global rating scales, and self report inventories.

courses.Subject: CFTP
courses.Title: Clinical Practicum/Supervision IV
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="533" dept="CFTP" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The purpose of the first-year practicum is for the students to develop foundational skills necessary for the practice of couple and family therapy. Students are expected to spend one hour weekly in on-site supervision (which may be a non-AAMFT-approved supervisor); in addition, students spend one hour weekly in off-site supervision, and/or 2 hours weekly in group supervision (with an AAMFT-approved supervisor).  An average of 8-10 client contact hours is expected each week for MFT students, with 10-12 client contact hours each week for PMC students.  Students must successfully complete practicum orientation in order to enroll in this course and subsequently complete each practicum.

courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name=""> <courses>  <course num="533" dept="CFTP" sect="003" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The purpose of the first-year practicum is for the students to develop foundational skills necessary for the practice of couple and family therapy. Students are expected to spend one hour weekly in on-site supervision (which may be a non-AAMFT-approved supervisor); in addition, students spend one hour weekly in off-site supervision, and/or 2 hours weekly in group supervision (with an AAMFT-approved supervisor).  An average of 8-10 client contact hours is expected each week for MFT students, with 10-12 client contact hours each week for PMC students.  Students must successfully complete practicum orientation in order to enroll in this course and subsequently complete each practicum.

courses.Subject: ARTS
courses.Title: For Thesis Only
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="625" dept="ARTS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This no-credit course is available to creative arts therapy students who have submitted the MA thesis to the advisory committee. Students in ARTS 625 are expected to defend the thesis, complete revisions and submit the final copy of the thesis for binding during the quarter covered by this course registration.

courses.Subject: ARTS
courses.Title: Practicum II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="809" dept="ARTS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The Practicum Module provides the practical application component of the doctoral program. The Practicum Module includes one quarter of the ARTS 812 Teaching Practicum and two quarters of Practicum  II and III of the student¿s choice in one of the following practical areas of study: 1) academia/teaching; 2) research; 3) clinical supervision, or, 4) advanced clinical practice. The goal of the practicum is to transform the knowledge learned to this point in the doctoral program into practical application and research in the creative arts therapies fields.

courses.Subject: ARTS
courses.Title: Practicum I
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="808" dept="ARTS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The practicum provides the practical application component of the doctoral program.  With faculty advisement, students choose one of the following practical areas of study:  1) academia/teaching; 2) research; 3) clinical supervision; or 4) advanced clinical practice.  The goal of the practicum is to transform knowledge learned in the doctoral program into practical application and research in the creative arts therapies fields.

The goal of the practicum is to  transform the  knowledge learned to this point in the doctoral program into practical application and research in the creative arts therapies fields.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Medical Terminology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="125" dept="HSCI" sect="940" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is an introduction to the language of medicine intended as foundational for future study and professional practice. Students will study the basic vocabulary of medicine as well as the structure underlying that vocabulary in order to enhance future study and education.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Health Assessment through the Lifespan
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="HSCI" sect="061" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Course focuses on health assessment across the lifespan. The focus is on the development of interviewing skills, assessment of health status, and physical examination skills for the beginning health professional student.

courses.Title: Health Assessment through the Lifespan
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="201" dept="HSCI" sect="063" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Description: Course focuses on health assessment across the lifespan. The focus is on the development of interviewing skills, assessment of health status, and physical examination skills for the beginning health professional student.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Current Issues in Health Sciences
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="315" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course is designed to discuss current issues and controversies in health science, with a focus on health-related issues attracting media attention. Topics may include: ethical dilemmas; how research informs healthcare policy; how research impacts healthcare practice; how interprofessional practice impacts patient safety and the patient experience in a culture of evidence-based practice; and cultural diversity, equity, and inclusion for underserved populations.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Genetics and Health
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="337" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers the fundamentals of human genetics from a healthcare perspective. The course presents concepts of classical genetics, outlines molecular mechanisms of heredity, and explores the evolving technological advances in DNA modifications and analysis. The course emphasizes the importance of the health professional in enhancing patient understanding of the impact of genetic technology in healthcare decisions. Additional topics include genetic counseling, assisted reproductive technologies and personal genomics.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Exercise for Special Populatio
courses.Instructor: Michael L Bruneau, Jodie L Haak
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="T480" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Pharmacology II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="302" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course focuses on common drugs used in the treatment of disorders of cardiovascular, renal, respiratory and gastrointestinal systems, anti-infective and anti-inflammatory agents, immune and biologic modifiers and chemotherapeutic agents, and miscellaneous hematologic, dermatologic, ophthalmic, ant otic agents.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Applied Anatomy and Kinesiology
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="326" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course applies the foundations of anatomy and physiology to the study of human movement, with emphasis on normal motions of the musculoskeletal system. Topical areas include musculoskeletal anatomy, neuroanatomy, biomechanics, lever systems, and the influence of musculoskeletal disease and injury in normal movement.

courses.Subject: HSCI
courses.Title: Exercise Testing and Prescription
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="425" dept="HSCI" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers the fundamental principles of exercise testing and prescription with an emphasis on the health-related components of physical fitness that include body composition, cardiorespiratory fitness, muscular strength, muscular endurance, and flexibility. Students use these principles to develop appropriate exercise prescriptions for healthy and selected clinical populations.  Laboratory experiences provide students with opportunities to engage in exercise testing and apply exercise prescription principles in health, fitness, and sport.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: Health Care Quality and the Legal Context
courses.Description: This course will provide students with tools for analyzing and assessing levels of patient safety and the quality of care being provided in a variety of health care settings such as physician practices, manages care plans, and long-term care facilities. This course will also explore developments in patient care, utilization review, risk management, and liability.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: The Business of Healthcare
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="564" dept="IPS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides a forum for the exploration and evaluation of financial management and the financial environment of the healthcare industry.  The student will develop an understanding of the budgeting and accounting process and how a fiscally responsible budget works in a climate of decreased government funding, shared cost mechanisms and decreased personnel resources in addition to basic financial management principles and tools.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: MCH Home Visiting
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="T580" dept="IPS" sect="901" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers special topics of relevance and significance to healthcare professionals. Topics decided upon by faculty will vary from term to term within the area of study.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: Creating a Culture of Safety
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="586" dept="IPS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course will focus on strategies to create a culture of safety in the healthcare environment.  The course incorporates established standards of practice and strategies designed to promote a safe care environment, build team competencies, leadership and communication skills.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: Forensic Science Foundations
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="519" dept="IPS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course examines the defining characteristics of offender behavior including the importance of obtaining complete victim histories, investigation of a motive and suspects as it relates to healthcare and practice. Investigative and therapeutic factors and approaches including examination of environment, place, time and crime scene indicators will be explored.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: ST: Hlthcre Qual-Patient Safet
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="T580" dept="IPS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course covers special topics of relevance and significance to healthcare professionals. Topics decided upon by faculty will vary from term to term within the area of study.

courses.Subject: IPS
courses.Title: Science of Safety, Human Factors, and System Thinking
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="585" dept="IPS" sect="900" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides a broad introduction to the science of safety, human factors and systems thinking as it relates to healthcare and safety. Students will examine system and design principles for safety and outcome improvements. Students will build knowledge, skills and attitudes necessary to serve in leadership roles to drive quality improvement and safety within healthcare systems.

courses.Subject: NEUR
courses.Title: Neuroscience II
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="508" dept="NEUR" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: The course is designed to provide the student with a strong foundation in the structure and function of the nervous system. Clinical correlations are provided throughout the course to: 1). underscore the necessity for understanding the material for effective clinical practice and 2). provide a neurophysiological basis for various pathological entities described in their clinical neurology courses and commonly encountered in the clinic.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Nutrition, Foods, and Health
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="UC"> <courses>  <course num="100" dept="NFS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Covers the six nutrient categories and how they function in the body. Includes nutritional implications of major diseases, food safety issues, and current food and nutrition controversies with an emphasis on personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Introduction to Nutrition & Food
courses.Description: Provides basic understanding of required nutrients and how they are used in the body. Students complete a computerized nutrient analysis and apply the science of nutrition and food to food choices to improve their personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Introduction to Nutrition & Food
courses.Description: Provides basic understanding of required nutrients and how they are used in the body. Students complete a computerized nutrient analysis and apply the science of nutrition and food to food choices to improve their personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Normal & Lifespan Nutrition
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="220" dept="NFS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Builds on basic nutrition principles to include nutrient metabolism and chemical and biological aspects of nutrition. Addresses special nutrient needs of people through the life cycle.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Lactation Supervised Practice
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="485" dept="NFS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Lactation Supervised Practice is designed to prepare competent, entry-level lactation consultants who will be eligible to sit the International Board Lactation Consultant Examination by completing Pathway 2. The course will provide appropriate experiences to practice the roles of lactation consultant under the supervision of a preceptor.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Nutrition, Foods, and Health
courses.Description: Covers the six nutrient categories and how they function in the body. Includes nutritional implications of major diseases, food safety issues, and current food and nutrition controversies with an emphasis on personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Introduction to Nutrition & Food
courses.Description: Provides basic understanding of required nutrients and how they are used in the body. Students complete a computerized nutrient analysis and apply the science of nutrition and food to food choices to improve their personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Introduction to Nutrition & Food
courses.Description: Provides basic understanding of required nutrients and how they are used in the body. Students complete a computerized nutrient analysis and apply the science of nutrition and food to food choices to improve their personal health.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Nutrition in Chronic Disease
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="315" dept="NFS" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course provides a basic understanding of nutrition therapy and its role in the prevention and treatment of medical conditions.

courses.Subject: NFS
courses.Title: Lactation Supervised Practice
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="485" dept="NFS" sect="002" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: Lactation Supervised Practice is designed to prepare competent, entry-level lactation consultants who will be eligible to sit the International Board Lactation Consultant Examination by completing Pathway 2. The course will provide appropriate experiences to practice the roles of lactation consultant under the supervision of a preceptor.

courses.Subject: PA
courses.Title: Health Policy for Physician Assistant Practice
courses.Textbook: http://drexel.bncollege.com/webapp/wcs/stores/servlet/TBListView?cm_mmc=RI-_-457-_-1-_-A&catalogId=10001&storeId=31061&langId=-1& termMapping=N&courseXml=<?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?>   <textbookorder> <school id="457"/>  <campus name="CC"> <courses>  <course num="546" dept="PA" sect="001" term="A19" />  </courses>  </campus> </textbookorder>
courses.Description: This course explores the UD health care system and health policy issues related to the coasts of health care, inequities in quality and access to care, and current US policies.
